programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: An eminent scientist on the brink of a major breakthrough in cancer research is found impaled on a razor-sharp samurai sword in his locked study. Jonathan and Maddie are called in to find out if this is a case of murder or an extremely elaborate suicide. Guest starring Annette Crosbie, with Alan Davies and Caroline Quentin

programme.title: Sherlock
programme.desc: The detective returns to investigate the apparent return from the dead of his old enemy Moriarty, but another strange case is soon demanding his attention. Scotland Yard is baffled by a mysterious criminal who is defacing images of Margaret Thatcher, and Sherlock is convinced there is a more sinister purpose at work behind these acts of vandalism - but his investigation digs up Mary Watson's dark past as an assassin. Benedict Cumberbatch, Martin Freeman and Amanda Abbington return for a fourth series of the detective drama

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Members of a all-women motorcycle club arrive in Brokenwood for the wedding of one of their number, but a murder casts suspicion amongst their ranks and throws the town into chaos. Detective drama set in a New Zealand town. Starring Neill Rea, Fern Sutherland, Pana Hema Taylor and Nic Sampson

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates when the new wife of Sir Raleigh is found dead in a locked room after seeing an Egyptian mummy. Crime drama, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: Case Histories
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jackson searches for the killer of a drowned girl whose body he found while out running, and also tries to help a novelist who became involved in a road-rage incident. However, a discovery at the hospital leaves the investigator wondering whether the seemingly unrelated incidents might be linked - but he also finds himself distracted by his daughter's imminent move to New Zealand. Crime drama, starring Jason Isaacs, with Keith Allen

programme.title: Case Histories
programme.desc: Part two of two. Louise, Marcus and Jackson investigate when a battered body is found in novelist Martin Canning's house, and the car involved in the road-rage incident is tracked to Gloria Hatter's husband. Jackson says goodbye to his daughter and, with help from Martin, discovers Hatter's cleaning company is forcing girls to work as prostitutes. Crime drama, starring Jason Isaacs, Adam Godley and Amanda Abbington

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: The Edinburgh detective investigates the murder of notorious gangster Morris Cafferty's illegitimate son, as the search goes on to find the person who put Sammy in a life-threatening coma. The hunt for the killer is complicated by apparent links to a spate of hate crimes by racist extremists in the city centre. Gritty crime thriller, starring John Hannah and James Cosmo

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Detective Inspector Mike Shepherd is sent to the New Zealand town of Brokenwood to investigate the death of a farmer, after his body is found by two local fishermen. As he uncovers a family's tragedies and secrets, he also learns that Brokenwood is a place where shadows lurk just beneath the surface. Drama, starring Neill Rea, Fern Sutherland, Pana Hema Taylor and Nic Sampson

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gritty police drama series. Bradford sets fire to Kane's house after finding out about him and Harman. Nixon and De Costa investigate a domestic violence case

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Brandon Kane blames Honey Harman for the fire that burnt down his house, and despite her protestations, it looks like their friendship is beyond repair - and to add insult to injury, Cathy Bradford delights in making her rival paranoid about the disaster. Adam Okaro is desperate to put away the teenage thugs who caused Yvonne Hemmingway's injuries, but his heavy-handed tactics lead to a riot

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Adam Okaro goes back on the frontline, where his time with Tony Stamp teaches him much about the pressures his officers face on a daily basis. Phil is placed in a difficult situation when Christine Weaver gets arrested for shoplifting and Gina Gold's duties as a senior officer are tested to the limit when Sheelagh Murphy goes into labour out in the field

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Christmas may be just around the corner, but the season of goodwill clearly doesn't have much effect on Cathy Bradford. Dealing with a man who destroyed all his wife's belongings as an act of vengeance after discovering she was cheating on him, the psycho-cop decides she's had enough of weak-willed men. As a result, she becomes increasingly frustrated with mild-mannered fiance Max, and wonders how much longer she can continue the charade of their happy relationship - but just how far is she willing to go to end it? Meanwhile, Jim Carver is back at work, only to get a painful reminder of his personal problems when he is assigned to a domestic violence case, and Dale Smith forms a bond with a teenager struggling to hold his family together on an estate run by rival drug-dealing gangs. Connie Hyde, Mark Wingett and Alex Walkinshaw star

programme.title: All Quiet on the Western Front (1979)
programme.desc: The stark realities of battle are revealed to a group of German teenagers who volunteer for action during the First World War. Drama remake, starring Richard Thomas, Ernest Borgnine and Donald Pleasence

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Glass Virgin
programme.desc: Feature-length drama from the pen of the popular storyteller. A woman runs away from her wealthy family after she discovers a shocking secret about her past. Nigel Havers, Emily Mortimer and Brendan Coyle star

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nation is in the grip of World Cup fever in 1966, and Fred has placed a risky accumulator bet on the outcome of the final which he starts to regret as the big match draws near. Nonnatus House awaits the arrival of four new pupil midwives, Dr Turner and Nurse Crane discover a 17-year-old boy is harbouring a desperate secret, and Cyril and Lucille's relationship continues to blossom

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: An elderly man is killed in his dilapidated mansion, prompting Gently and Bacchus to delve into the building's past as a children's home. They soon have their prime suspect - a man who once lived there - but it becomes clear that some of the locals, including property developer Cora Davidson, have something to hide. Feature-length drama, guest starring Matthew McNulty and Jill Halfpenny, with Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: A famous gothic horror writer is found murdered on Halloween, leading Maddy and Jonathan into a macabre world of pantomime skeletons, reincarnation and severed heads. Offbeat detective drama, starring Alan Davies and Caroline Quentin, with Peter Davison and Pippa Haywood

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Maddy and Jonathan investigate the intriguing case of a businessman with an acute fear of watches and clocks who appears to have defied the laws of nature. Evidence soon emerges suggesting he has a bizarre ability to make time stand still - but it could be just an elaborate hoax. Offbeat detective drama, starring Alan Davies and Caroline Quentin

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A woman shoots her unfaithful husband and it appears to be an open-and-shut case - until the team discovers the man was already dead. Mark McManus stars

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The annual wine show is a major event in Brokenwood and no one is looking forward to it more than DI Mike, the recent buyer of a 10-acre vineyard. However, when a guest judge and wine critic are found dead, drowned inside a fermenting vat, the show takes second place to the murder investigation. Neill Rea, Fern Sutherland, Pana Hema Taylor and Nic Sampson star

Her sleeplessness is getting to her, but hope comes through unexpected information about Clemence's daughter which might hold the answer to her own child's fate. Colman feels that he has the evidence he needs to place Lorna and Aoife together, until a final showdown with Lorna takes an unexpected turn

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, including Arsenal v Manchester United at Emirates Stadium. Arsenal won last season's corresponding fixture 3-2, and United have found away wins against the top sides hard to come by under Eric Ten Hag. Plus, Liverpool v Aston Villa at Anfield, Crystal Palace v Wolverhampton Wanderers at Selhurst Park and a round-up of Friday and Saturday's goals

programme.title: Children of Men (2006)
programme.desc: In a future blighted by mass infertility, the human race is one generation from extinction and the world has plunged into chaos. In a totalitarian Britain, a jaded former activist tries to protect the first woman to become pregnant in nearly 20 years. However, a militant underground group plans to use her for its own ends. Thriller, starring Clive Owen, Michael Caine and Julianne Moore

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: In Wakefield, a police officer is the victim of a violent attack. Greater Manchester Police tackle knife crime. The RAF are called in to help transatlantic rowers in distress

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: A UK toxicologist uncovers a murder plot when a woman is found dead in an Egyptian hotel room, and a cell communications analyst helps solve the murder of a Northern Irish teacher

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A first-time developer transforms a terrace property in Stoke-on-Trent, while more seasoned developers tackle projects in Leeds and Rugby in Warwickshire. Presented by Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian explores a perplexing mystery at from the Great Wetherby Racecourse Antiques Fair in West Yorkshire. With experts Caroline Hawley and Colin Young

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Daniel has a nasty surprise for Zara, and Claudia learns more about Bear. Meanwhile, Rosie tries to make amends

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore visits Witley recycling centre in Surrey, recovering a wooden cabinet in disrepair, four mixed style chairs and a metal trunk full of vintage tools

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse helps a couple to find a new home closer to their son in Northumbria, and also pays a visit to the Northumberland National Park

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill come up with plans to transform a Liverpool garden into an alpine-themed area suitable for two young children, their ski-loving parents and a dog

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Stephen Mangan on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Eve and Martin learn the truth about Stacey's stalker but Theo intercepts their warning messages to her. Gina humiliates Cindy in the Vic and Ben and Lexi prepare for her first day of secondary school. Lily goes into labour

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Vaping among Britain's teenagers is on the rise and there's growing concern some companies are targeting under-age vapers. So, should we be worried about young people getting addicted? Rachel Burden investigates the youth vaping phenomenon and talks to young people, parents, and experts about how to tackle it

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and a team of ethical hackers hunt down the scammers plaguing people's lives, using cutting-edge technology to monitor fraudsters' phone calls

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: The genealogy documentary follows eight more celebrities as they trace their family trees to uncover facts about their heritage. First up is Our Girl actress Michelle Keegan, who discovers the dark story of how her great-grandmother Leonor, who lived on Gibraltar, was evacuated during the Second World War. She then goes further back to her great-great-grandmother, who lived in poverty in Manchester at the start of the 20th century. But as Michelle investigates, she unearths a special connection to the suffragette movement

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop are joined by a variety of guest hosts and panellists from the worlds of comedy, journalism and current affairs in this compilation edition revisiting the big news stories of 2022

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present the music-based quiz show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Competing to show off their music knowledge are siblings Mairi and Alastair from Glasgow, mother and daughter Angela and Riziki from Brighton, and couple Mina and Paul from Birmingham and London

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels and Duggee meet a lion with bad breath

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels meet a chameleon

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: The Veggies are delighted with a new tablet they've found, but when they're not looking, Evil Pea turns it to evil mode and it soon takes over the supermarket

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun and Bitzer work together to track down a nut thief

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Dennis and his mates rebel against an outbreak of fun-killing rules that are being imposed on Beanotown

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: The kids visit an eco camp to learn how to grow vegetables. Unfortunately, the Smith twins are also there and have no intention of pulling their weight

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Ant searches a chasm for clues to his grandparents' fate

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: History buff Hector from Wigan is a huge fan of William Shakespeare and wants a space of his own where he can store all his history books, write plays and enjoy his hero's works

programme.title: One Zoo Three
programme.desc: The three brothers are on a mission to compose a zoo musical using the sounds of the animals

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing professional Graziano Di Prima set the presenters a dance challenge, while Joel heads to Blackpool with a magic superfan, and chef Jamie Oliver earns his very own gold Blue Peter badge

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall dives with hammerhead and tiger sharks, exploring how to save them from extinction

programme.title: Super Cute Animals
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Gordon Buchanan embarks on a global journey to find some of the world's cutest animals, aiming to understand why people find them so endearing and revealing the surprising science behind each creature. He begins with the giant panda, whose unusually large head tells a story of millions of years of evolution and survival. Gordon also reveals how the fennec fox's ears are crucial to its survival, discovers the surprising secret behind a penguin's waddle and meets a five-year-old chimpanzee whose giggle reveals new information about man's evolution

programme.title: Britain's Secret Seas
programme.desc: Explorer Paul Rose teams up with biologist Tooni Mahto and underwater archaeologist Frank Pope to explore the secrets of the waters surrounding Britain. The trio begin by highlighting marine life in and around the western seas, including basking sharks off the Cornish shore and spider crabs in the shallows of south Wales, as well as creatures in a protected area around Lundy Island off the Devon coast

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: The Wanda Diamond League Xiamen. Live coverage of the 12th meeting of the season, held at Egret Stadium in China. This is the first time Xiamen has hosts a Diamond League event, with the meetings in this country typically taking place at Shanghai, and many of the world's biggest names are expected to compete in the state-of-the-art venue

programme.title: Scott of the Antarctic (1948)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama following explorer Robert Falcon Scott's failed expedition to be the first to reach the South Pole. The extreme conditions, poor decision-making and the pressure of the race to make it to the Pole before their Norwegian rivals proved too much for the British team, resulting in tragedy in 1912. Starring John Mills, Derek Bond, James Robertson Justice, Kenneth More and John Gregson

programme.title: Our Wild Adventures
programme.desc: BBC wildlife presenters and crew take a trip through the natural history archives, beginning by sharing some of their most memorable animal encounters across Africa. Gordon Buchanan reminisces about the start of his career when he was 17, Chris Packham looks back on of his adventures in Kenya, and Steve Backshall shares a story about diving with Nile crocodiles in the Okavango delta of Botswana

programme.title: Marcus Wareing's Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: The chef ventures out to Romney Marsh to meet shepherd Chris to learn what gives salt-marsh lamb its flavour, and visits a nearby school that has set up its own farm

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Jennie McAlpine, Ugo Monye, Joe Pasquale and Felicity Ward test their general knowledge skills before the week's winner is revealed by Richard Osman

programme.title: Fantasy Film Music at the Proms
programme.desc: Radio 3 presenter Katie Derham and Radio 1 film critic Ali Plumb host an evening of magical soundtracks from film, TV and gaming's greatest fantasies, myths and legends. Anna-Maria Helsing conducts the BBC Concert Orchestra and the Huddersfield Choral Society in music from the Harry Potter, Star Wars and Lord of the Rings film franchises, as well as Game of Thrones, World of Warcraft, Good Omens and His Dark Materials

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: A selection of performances by some of the most popular all-girl groups to have appeared on the show, from the pop-soul vocal ensembles of the 1960s to the glamorous bands of the new millennium. Includes songs by the Supremes, Labelle, TLC, Spice Girls, the Pointer Sisters and B*Witched

programme.title: Bananarama at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances by the pop group, featuring many of the 25 Top 40 singles they released over their career. It's a selection that covers those early days when the Fun Boy Three first introduced pop fans to the original line-up of Keren Woodward, Sara Dallin and Siobhan Fahey on It Ain't What You Do, as well as the end of the 1980s when Siobhan left and was replaced by Jacquie O'Sullivan

programme.title: Girls Aloud: Tangled Up Live from the O2
programme.desc: Footage of the band's 2008 tour, filmed at the O2 Arena in London. Songs include Love Machine, Biology, Call the Shots and Sound of the Underground

programme.title: Labelle in Concert
programme.desc: The American funk rock band perform a selection of their songs in this 1975 concert - their first appearance on British TV

programme.title: The Spice Girls at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of performances by the group on BBC shows from over the years, from their breakout number one Wannabe through to their final release Headlines. There are also hits the members enjoyed when they launched themselves as solo stars, including Mel B and Missy Elliott's I Want You Back and Melanie C's duet with Bryan Adams on When You're Gone

programme.title: Pop Life
programme.desc: A look at life within all-female bands- a heady and combustible mix of talent, ambition and hairspray. Those lifting the lid on a life of girl power, baby love and walking like Egyptians are members of the Spice Girls, Bananarama, Girls Aloud, the Bangles, Sister Sledge, the Ronettes and the Supremes

programme.title: T20 Cricket
programme.desc: Action from the second in the three-match series, held at the Cloud County Ground in Chelmsford

programme.title: The Woman in the Wall
programme.desc: Mystery, starring Ruth Wilson as Lorna Brady, who wakes from sleepwalking to find a corpse in her house. She has no idea who the dead woman is or if she's responsible for the apparent murder. Re-tracing her steps, Lorna realises that the mysterious woman could be linked to her past in the town's Magdalene Laundry. Meanwhile in Dublin, Detective Colman Akande is confronted with the murder of a local priest. Tracking the case brings him into Lorna's orbit

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Glorious Gardens from Above
programme.desc: Horticulturist Christine Walkden embarks on a journey to explore some of the most impressive gardens in the UK - from a hot-air balloon. In the first edition, she hovers above Cornwall, and finds herself overwhelmed with nostalgia by the giant Brazilian gunnera. Later, she meets a man whose childhood was spent playing in the garden, before testing her nerves at St Michael's Mount where she encounters 'gardening on the edge'

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Matt Baker head to the Usk Valley within Bannau Brycheiniog, and look at a series of projects which aim to lead the National Park into a more sustainable future. However, not everyone has welcomed this change. Plus, Charlotte Smith investigates if the race to protect land for nature could threaten livestock farms, and Adam Henson introduces the first two competitors for this year's one man and his dog competition

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn just around the corner, Adam Frost takes stock of his garden and plans ahead for some late-season interest under the supervision of Ash the cat. Frances Tophill visits a garden in Kent where the plants provide a non-stop buffet for insects, while Nick Bailey travels to Cornwall to revel in the glory of hardy palms

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter checks Beechgrove's sweet peas, this year planted with a blue theme to mark the programme's Sapphire (45th) anniversary, while Lizzie Schofield is propagating strawberries. There's an update from Calum Clunie at his allotment in Leven, while Brian Cunningham looks at plant names at Old Scone and there is a visit to a fabulous garden in the south-west of Scotland

programme.title: Life in a Cottage Garden with Carol Klein
programme.desc: In July and August, the horticulturist deadheads the roses and stakes plants to help keep the garden looking its best during the summer months, and savours the full blooms of geraniums and lilies. She creates colourful borders using cannas, ginger and dahlias, before visiting her local beach, Braunton Burrows, to seek out native sea holly, which she hopes to grow herself

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt takes a look back at more of his favourite recipes and best moments from Saturday Kitchen

programme.title: Mary Berry's Quick Cooking
programme.desc: Mary joins the crowds as she attends a music festival for the first time to explore the pop-up food stalls and enlists headliner Rick Astley to help make her speedy cheesy muffins. She also prepares scrumptious rosemary lamb steaks, vegetable kebabs and rum and raisin ice-cream

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge is joined by fellow Michelin-starred chef Raymond Blanc to cook two dishes using ingredients that have fallen out of favour. Raymond recreates a favourite souffle from his childhood using semolina and heritage apples vying for favour against the host's old-fashioned mutton chops with cabbage and turnip gratin. Plus, Oliver Peyton reports on a distilling revival

programme.title: The Importance of Being Earnest (1952)
programme.desc: Two friends lead double lives, adopting an alternative identity when it suits their purposes, but both tricksters come to realise their duplicity is about to jeopardise their romantic endeavours. Comedy, based on Oscar Wilde's stage play, starring Michael Redgrave, Michael Denison, Edith Evans, Margaret Rutherford, Dorothy Tutin and Joan Greenwood

programme.title: Live Equestrian
programme.desc: Live coverage of the event in Stamford, Lincolnshire, as the prestigious four-day event reaches its conclusion with the show jumping discipline

programme.title: The Remains of the Day (1993)
programme.desc: A butler in a 1930s aristocratic household has dedicated himself to serving his master, putting duty above all else and repressing his affection for the housekeeper, who also happens to be in love with him. On the outbreak of war, the nobleman's Nazi sympathies come to light, marking a change of heart in the old servant, who looks back with misgivings about the loyalty that may have cost him dearly. Period drama, with Anthony Hopkins, Emma Thompson and James Fox

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Antiques experts Michael Baggott and Caroline Hawley inspect an oriental carving and a model of a Second World War V1 bomb brought in by members of the public looking to make a sale at Derbyshire's Haddon Hall. Plus, presenter Paul Martin explores the history of the Peak District National Park

programme.title: The People's Piazza: A History of Covent Garden
programme.desc: David Olusoga explores the 400-year history of the public space in London's West End, which has been a market, a meeting place and a site of protest, performance and renewal. Telling the story of the piazza from its early years as a playground for the aristocracy, through decline and dereliction to eventual rebirth, the programme weaves archive material with virtual production techniques to bring to life the history of this renowned civic space

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Rob Rinder travel to the highlands of central Sri Lanka to learn about Ceylon Tea Trails - a series of colonial era bungalows that have been renovated and revisioned by a local family of tea entrepreneurs. Monica works with the tea pickers and learns the importance of the industry to the country, while Rob tracks leopards in the surrounding plantations. The highlands are a rugged landscape, but as Rob and Monica discover, with dedication and detail, guests can still get a luxury experience

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer head to Mid-Wales as the embark on another series of angling trips round the UK, fishing for chub in the Irfon and Wye rivers. The friends also meet David Lyons, the founder of charity Tackling Minds, which helps people with depression, anxiety or are recovering from addiction to get out to rivers and lakes to fish

programme.title: The Fast Show
programme.desc: A brother and sister discuss the joys of living on the Isle of Man, Unlucky Alf buys a parrot and a doctor jokes to a patient about cancer. Tommy Cockles talks about Bogart and Bacall, Bob Fleming tries to speak about fishing tackle, and Ron Manager waxes lyrical about alcohol. First aired in 1994

programme.title: Judy (2019)
programme.desc: Judy Garland is embroiled in a tug-of-war with husband Sidney Luft for custody of their children, Lorna and Joey. Crippled by debt, the showbiz legend reluctantly agrees to a run of shows in London. Unfortunately, fiance Mickey Deans continually distracts her when she should be rehearsing. Biopic, starring Oscar and Bafta-winner Renee Zellweger, with Jessie Buckley and Rufus Sewell

programme.title: Golf: Walker Cup Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the 49th staging of the amateur team competition between Great Britain & Ireland and USA, held this year at the Old Course at St Andrews in Fife

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A claim for a quarter of a million euros goes up in flames when a holiday fire turns out to be smoke and mirrors and a martial artist's social media exposes his lies

programme.title: The Woman in the Wall
programme.desc: Lorna has no intention of sleeping until she finds out what Aoife Cassidy knew. The town's laundry survivors campaign for justice, and Lorna discovers that Aoife spoke to another survivor. Colman and local guard Massey join forces to track down Father Percy's murderer. Key evidence has been destroyed, but Colman identifies his murder suspect as Aoife Cassidy, whilst Lorna's strange behaviour brings her to his attention

programme.title: The Following Events Are Based on a Pack of Lies
programme.desc: Alice begins investigating her conman ex-husband as he starts dating a famous author. After 15 years, she's determined to get the truth but it turns out the pair must work together if they're ever going to stop him. Drama, starring Rebekah Staton

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The teams search for antiques in Exeter, taking on board expert advice provided by Richard Madley and Ben Cooper. Christina Trevanion presents, and also travels to the south-west coast to learn about the history of the sea shanty

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Amanda Tatchell and Julie Middleditch join forces with David Burville to get a treasured baby doll back to its beautiful best by addressing her cracked face and crumbling hands and feet. A worn-out suitcase dating from the Second World War and a seized-up silver locket are also restored. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive travels to the Conegliano region in the foothills of the Alps, to find out about the production of his favourite tipple Prosecco. One of the country's few female female wine-makers explains about the grapes they use - and when the importance of the harvest - before inviting him to spend the night in a giant wine barrel. Moving on, vintage car fan Clive joins the 100 Miglia rally and hunts for antiques in the hilltop town of Asolo

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: From Tewkesbury in Gloucestershire, Michael Portillo heads to the castle of Eastnor at the foot of the Malvern Hills. He also visits Coleford in the Forest of Dean, Slimbridge in Gloucestershire, and Bristol Temple Meads. From there he heads to Filton to investigate the centre of Britain's post-war aviation industry

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Jeremy Dein and Sasha Wass return to tackle more potential miscarriages of justice as they re-examine historic murder cases on behalf of the family of those convicted. In the first edition they investigate their oldest case yet, the murder of a canal boat passenger 180 years ago in which boatmen were convicted and publicly hanged

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The evolutionary documentary concludes, as David Attenborough profiles the Siamese fighting fish, so aggressive it will fight its own reflection until it is exhausted. He also looks at the kangaroo - once pitted against humans in the boxing ring - which has a kick so strong it can kill

programme.title: Back in Time for the Factory
programme.desc: Fifty years ago, 34 per cent of the British population worked in manufacturing. Factories mostly employed women, who made an array of clothes and household items that were sold all over the world. Alex Jones presents this documentary in which a group of modern workers go back in time to learn what life was like for women through the 1960s to the 1980s. They start in a re-creation of 1968, when the bulk of high street clothes were made in the UK. The reality of the production line is a rude awakening for many - long monotonous hours with short breaks and few distractions - a situation made even worse when they open their pay packets

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off on the first leg of a journey across Northern Ireland to Argyll and Bute, beginning by travelling from Newry to Portadown

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team visit Herstmonceux Castle, where antiques experts Jonathan Pratt and James Lewis find treasures to take to auction, including some beautiful bronze sculptures. Paul Martin takes a trip on a very large miniature railway

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Jen Brister, Kelvin Fletcher, Ian Moore and Zoe Williams go toe to toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Marcus Wareing's Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef visits a trout farm to learn about sustainable fishing, and builds a cold smoker with the help of his friend and fire expert Chris Taylor

programme.title: Chris and Meg's Wild Summer
programme.desc: Chris Packham and his stepdaughter Megan McCubbin continue their a wildlife-watching road trip by exploring North Wales, where highlights include spotting red kites, feral goats and sand lizards, as well as climbing Snowdon, and having a go on the world's fastest zipwire

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking questions on the specialist subjects of Karl Marx, The Royle Family, the flags of British counties, and Django Reinhardt, before each is tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts another first-round match as film fans the Video Nastiestake on family team the Solomons. They must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues comprising Green Monster, Small Chandelier, Stone Sausage, and Merrygold Robin

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: Amol Rajan asks the questions in another first-round match, with four students from the Open University pitting their wits against a team from Hertford College, Oxford in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition

programme.title: Murder Trial: The Disappearance of Renee and Andrew MacRae
programme.desc: The trial of William MacDowell continues and the jury members hear the dramatic testimony of Renee's best friend and confidante, while the senior investigating officer retraces MacDowell's steps on the night in question. There is compelling testimony suggesting MacDowell attempted to create a fake alibi, and a final witness is called as the Crown's case nears conclusion

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: Denise has a hangover, but claims it is migraine, brought on by stress from the forthcoming wedding. Jim feels depressed by the rest of the family's insistence on ignoring his wishes and celebrating his birthday, so it is cut-price cakes, family photos and bubbly all round

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Manhunter (1986)
programme.desc: A former FBI agent is coaxed out of retirement to track down a serial killer behind the slaughter of entire families. The detective needs an angle on the murderer's psychology and the only way to get this insight is to face his nightmares and consult cannibalistic psychopath Dr Hannibal Lecktor in prison. Michael Mann's thriller, based on Thomas Harris's novel Red Dragon, with William Petersen, Dennis Farina, Tom Noonan, Brian Cox and Joan Allen

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Matt Baker head to the Usk Valley within Bannau Brycheiniog, and look at a series of projects which aim to lead the National Park into a more sustainable future. However, not everyone has welcomed this change. Plus, Charlotte Smith investigates if the race to protect land for nature could threaten livestock farms, and Adam Henson introduces the first two competitors for this year's one man and his dog competition

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The first of the semi-finals is hosted in County Durham at the Beamish Museum. The contestants are thrown in at the deep end, cooking in tents and using unfamiliar equipment to serve up a four course meal for 100 of the museum's staff and volunteers

programme.title: Henpocalypse!
programme.desc: Mother-of-the bride Bernadette outlines an outrageous plan to improve post-apocalyptic life for everyone, but faces opposition. Shelly tries to make amends for her past mistakes. Comedy, starring Lucie Shorthouse, Elizabeth Berrington, Callie Cooke, Lauren O'Rourke and Kate O'Flynn

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Lost Land of the Volcano
programme.desc: Scientists and wildlife film-makers led by Steve Backshall, George McGavin and Gordon Buchanan explore Mount Bosavi, a giant extinct volcano covered by thick and largely unexplored rainforest in New Guinea. With the help of trackers from a remote tribe, they search for rare creatures and species to find evidence that may help stop the area's trees being felled for timber. The nest of the world's smallest parrot, an unusual beetle and new types of frog, gecko and bat are among the team's first discoveries

programme.title: Ray Mears' Northern Wilderness
programme.desc: The survival expert continues to explore the Canadian wilderness and learns about the history of the Hudson's Bay Company, which dealt in fur and was established in 1670. Ray examines the skills used by the business's early traders and trappers, gaining an insight into how they laid the foundations for modern Canada

programme.title: DNA
programme.desc: The health of Maria and Thorstein's baby improves and they are able to put the transplant on hold. Rolf travels to France to chase up a lead from one of the impounded phones and seeks help from his French colleague Claire. Neel questions a former footballer who owns the temping agency and Mario tries to find his sister at a brothel. In Danish

programme.title: DNA
programme.desc: Julita visits Rolf in Denmark, in search of the truth about her daughter. Neel questions the employees at Work-Force and Claire finds a connection between a travel agency and a Danish organisation. In Danish

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.desc: Michael Parkinson welcomes Dr Jacob Bronowski, the presenter and writer of the 1973 documentary series The Ascent of Man. The academic shares his first impressions on arriving in England in the 1920s, his memories of filming at Auschwitz and his thoughts on science and his broader philosophy of life. First shown in February 1974

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.desc: Highlights of Michael Parkinson's interviews with leading actresses Bette Midler, Lauren Bacall, Ingrid Bergman, Bette Davis, Raquel Welch, Shirley MacLaine, Gloria Swanson and Miss Piggy

programme.title: Oppenheimer
programme.desc: December 1953, and Oppenheimer has been accused of being a Soviet agent. The President has cancelled his security clearance until his case is fully investigated, leaving the scientist to choose between resignation or a security hearing. Starring Sam Waterston

programme.title: Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em
programme.desc: Frank survives an accident-prone journey to see Betty in hospital - and the medical staff soon find themselves wishing he'd arrived as a patient rather than a visitor. Michael Crawford, Michele Dotrice and Elisabeth Sladen star

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Hacker is challenged to convince Sir Humphrey that a computer holding vital citizen information could raise concerns about people's rights to privacy. Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne star

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: Shadow minister Peter Mannion is due to visit to check out the department before the general election - which is yet another distraction for Nicola on a day when nothing seems to be going right. However, while trying to force Glenn and Olly to kick-start her new initiative, she receives an important call. Political comedy, with Rebecca Front and guest star Roger Allam

programme.title: Scene By Scene
programme.desc: Mark Cousins interviews Rod Steiger, star of numerous classics including On the Waterfront, Dr Zhivago, Oklahoma, The Pawnbroker and In the Heat of the Night. Never a conventional leading man, Steiger nevertheless changed the direction of movies and opened the way for the distinctive performances of Robert de Niro, who referred to him as the most important actor of his generation

programme.title: Pappano's Greatest Arias
programme.desc: Antonio Pappano, conductor and music director of the Royal Opera House, shares his favourite arias from the medium's 400-year history, taking into account such varied traditions as baroque, romantic, verismo and bel canto, as well as more contemporary techniques. The programme also includes workshops with some of the biggest opera stars on the modern stage, including Joyce DiDonato, Lucy Crowe, Bryan Hymel and Lawrence Brownlee, as well as classic archive performances from Placido Domingo, Gundula Janowitz and Piero Cappuccilli

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: The presenter of Radio 3's New Music Show chooses his standout premieres and commissions from this year's Proms, all of which Tom believes respond to the world with joy, beauty and optimism. Highlights include Andrea Tarrodi's Birds of Paradise, inspired by footage from David Attenborough's Planet Earth, Ukrainian composer Bohdana Frolyak's Let There Be Light, and Errolyn Wallen's new work The Whole World, for the National Youth Orchestra

programme.title: Uncle Vanya
programme.desc: Acclaimed 2020 production of Chekhov's play at London's Harold Pinter Theatre, which was filmed for streaming under lockdown conditions after being cancelled due to Covid-19. Toby Jones plays the title role of the manager of a remote rural estate where the simple, ordered existence is disrupted by the arrival of an aged academic and his younger wife. As he becomes desperately infatuated with her, she in turn is drawn to a local doctor consumed by his own personal demons. With Richard Armitage and Roger Allam

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: An examination of humankind's rise to dominance, focusing on the facilities that separate humans from other animals and promote the desire for self-knowledge

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.desc: Michael Parkinson welcomes Dr Jacob Bronowski, the presenter and writer of the 1973 documentary series The Ascent of Man. The academic shares his first impressions on arriving in England in the 1920s, his memories of filming at Auschwitz and his thoughts on science and his broader philosophy of life. First shown in February 1974

programme.title: Pappano's Greatest Arias
programme.desc: Antonio Pappano, conductor and music director of the Royal Opera House, shares his favourite arias from the medium's 400-year history, taking into account such varied traditions as baroque, romantic, verismo and bel canto, as well as more contemporary techniques. The programme also includes workshops with some of the biggest opera stars on the modern stage, including Joyce DiDonato, Lucy Crowe, Bryan Hymel and Lawrence Brownlee, as well as classic archive performances from Placido Domingo, Gundula Janowitz and Piero Cappuccilli

programme.title: Lost Land of the Volcano
programme.desc: Scientists and wildlife film-makers led by Steve Backshall, George McGavin and Gordon Buchanan explore Mount Bosavi, a giant extinct volcano covered by thick and largely unexplored rainforest in New Guinea. With the help of trackers from a remote tribe, they search for rare creatures and species to find evidence that may help stop the area's trees being felled for timber. The nest of the world's smallest parrot, an unusual beetle and new types of frog, gecko and bat are among the team's first discoveries

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's rail trek along the coast of Northumberland continues towards the Farne Islands, takes in the holy island of Lindisfarne, and finishes in England's northernmost town, Berwick-upon-Tweed

programme.title: Climbing Great Buildings
programme.desc: Architectural historian Jonathan Foyle and climber Lucy Creamer scale Layer Marney Tower near Colchester to discover the innovations of the Tudor builders and craftsmen, and reveal the connection between Parmesan cheese and the ornate terracotta carvings that decorate the building

programme.title: The Riviera: A History in Pictures
programme.desc: Part one of two. Actor Richard E Grant follows in the footsteps of artists who lived and painted on France's Cote d'Azur, renowned for its sunny climate. The first edition focuses on the relationship between modern art and the location's development as an international tourist haven. Cezanne, Monet and Renoir were captivated by the light and colour of the landscape in the 19th century and their resultant work advertised the region's beauty. Meanwhile, the area's vivid hues inspired Henri Matisse to adopt a new palette that set modern art on the route to abstraction

programme.title: Oceans Apart: Art and the Pacific with James Fox
programme.desc: Art historian James Fox explores how New Zealand's indigenous Maori people resisted colonisation and marginalisation, and maintained their distinctive culture, so much so that it is now an integral part of modern New Zealand and celebrated all over the world. He shows how, from the beginning of their encounters with Europeans, the Maori adapted outside influences, whether it was modern firearms or the new religion of Christianity, and produced fascinating hybrid work that ranged from elaborately carved rifle butts to a Madonna and Child statue adorned with the Ta Moko, the sacred Maori facial tattoo

programme.title: Royal History's Biggest Fibs with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: The historian examines how writers, politicians and artists have manipulated the history of the Spanish Armada. She takes a look at the most famous parts of the story, from Francis Drake's game of bowls to Elizabeth I rousing her troops at Tilbury, and reveals how in Victorian times, the story was used as propaganda for the British Empire

programme.title: Invasion! with Sam Willis
programme.desc: The historian reveals a story of invasion in Britain spanning millennia, beginning with him felling a tree with a flint axe in Kent, and riding an Iron Age chariot. Sam Willis also searches for clues of invasion at Silbury Hill, and tracks down evidence of the Beaker people, who brought ceramics, metalwork and beakers to Britain

programme.title: Ray Mears' Northern Wilderness
programme.desc: The survival expert continues to explore the Canadian wilderness and learns about the history of the Hudson's Bay Company, which dealt in fur and was established in 1670. Ray examines the skills used by the business's early traders and trappers, gaining an insight into how they laid the foundations for modern Canada

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's rail trek along the coast of Northumberland continues towards the Farne Islands, takes in the holy island of Lindisfarne, and finishes in England's northernmost town, Berwick-upon-Tweed

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Giovanna and Baby Bear welcome babies Theo, River, Arthur, Reece, Luna and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers, and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Giovanna has got a blue bib and blue sunglasses inside her bag. All the parents and babies have different blue toys and objects in their bags too, which are explored through play, songs and a story. Parents, carers, and their little ones at home are encouraged to hide a safe, baby-appropriate blue object or toy inside a fabric bag or pillowcase, and then play with the items together! The traditional nursery rhyme Little Boy Blue features, as does a story about Baby Bear and Baby Tiger dressing up in blue things, and viewers at home show how they’ve been exploring the colour blue too. The Together Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with sensory scarves and the Goodbye Song.

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Disa's family comes from the Scandinavian country, Sweden. She is baking kardemummabullar, which is a Swedish recipe for cardamom buns. Disa makes a milk mixture, sweetened with honey, and mixes it into flour to make a dough. She then grinds her special ingredient of cardamom into a powder and adds some into the dough and the rest of it into brown sugar. The dough is flattened, the brown sugar and cardamom mix is spread onto the dough and folded in. The dough is then cut into strips and twisted and wrapped into a bun ready to be baked. Will her friends like the cardamom when it's baked in her kardemummabullar?

programme.title: Maddie, the Plants and You
programme.desc: Join Maddie on an adventure around the world of flowers to see how we can help to look after them and our planet. Find out how flowers and different animals, like bees, birds, butterflies and insects, work together. We learn how bees and insects pollinate flowers, as Maddie becomes a bee and plays the pollination game! Along the way, we’ll discover flowers of all different shapes, sizes and colours and learn why they are so different. We discover the different parts of a flower, the stigma, the anther, the stamen and the petals and how some flowers go to sleep at night and open in the day!

programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing stars Anton Du Beke, Katya Jones and Graziano Di Prima join Nick Knowles and the team in Wallsend, Newcastle. Together, they set to work transforming the True Colours performing arts school, an inclusive dance school that teaches dance and theatre skills to 500 children and young adults weekly, many of whom have disabilities and learning needs. The school has grown substantially over time and they've completely outgrown their existing space, so the team get to work renovating a run-down old boys club that would give the dance school the extra space it so desperately needs to continue to transform more young lives

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: Derek Brockway walks the Dee Valley Way, a stunning 13-mile route which takes him from the pretty town of Corwen to its larger and more bustling neighbour, Llangollen. On his trek, he learns about a warrior prince, re-opens a pub and leads a horse-drawn barge along the Llangollen Canal. Wildlife expert Lizzie Daly also sees how a re-homed family of beavers is settling in and Matt Bassett crosses the jaw dropping Pontcysyllte Aqueduct in a specially adapted canoe

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Stephen Greer has served many years in jail for drugs, firearm and paramilitary offences. During his last sentence he started taking art classes - and found it changed his life. Stephen returns to HM Prison Magilligan for the first time since his release to trial a new pilot scheme teaching art to prisoners. His hope is that art will transform the current offenders' lives as it did his. Contributors include a man serving two years for criminal damage, assault and breaching a restraining order and another, who is serving five years for actual bodily harm, grievous bodily harm and assault

programme.title: Question of Sport

Van driver Gary's got no time to waste as he navigates his way round the streets of Llanelli delivering 120 parcels. Elsewhere, veteran driver Phil aka 'The Donk' gives recently recruited receptionist Jess a crash-course in all things trucking - quite literally - with a day out to the Pembrey Truck Races

programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, including Arsenal v Manchester United at Emirates Stadium. Plus, Liverpool v Aston Villa at Anfield, Crystal Palace v Wolverhampton Wanderers at Selhurst Park and a round-up of Friday and Saturday's goals

programme.title: Children of Men (2006)
programme.desc: In a future blighted by mass infertility, the human race is one generation from extinction and the world has plunged into chaos. In a totalitarian Britain, a jaded former activist tries to protect the first woman to become pregnant in nearly 20 years. However, a militant underground group plans to use her for its own ends. Thriller, starring Clive Owen, Michael Caine and Julianne Moore

programme.title: Pizza Boys: World Cup Adventure
programme.desc: Jez and Ieuz take a culinary tour of France, stopping at every city where Wales will play in their Rugby World Cup group stage games. Their first destination is Bordeaux, where they visit a famous market and sample the Mexican twist on the pastries at one of the city's most innovative patisseries. They also meet a brewer trying to turn a wine-loving region into a beer-loving one

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Host Rob Brydon and captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack welcome Angellica Bell, Bob Mortimer, Suggs and Holly Willoughby to the comedy panel show on which the teams reveal extraordinary stories about themselves. But are they telling the truth, or are they making it all up?

programme.title: Being Louis Rees-Zammit
programme.desc: Unfiltered access to rugby's new superstar. From the intense training off the field to the post-match debriefs with his family at home, this is what it is like to be Louis Rees-Zammit. Includes contributions from team-mate Dan Biggar and World Cup Winner and top try scorer, Bryan Habana

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Vaping among Britain's teenagers is on the rise and there's growing concern some companies are targeting under-age vapers. So, should we be worried about young people getting addicted? Rachel Burden investigates the youth vaping phenomenon and talks to young people, parents, and experts about how to tackle it

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: The genealogy documentary follows eight more celebrities as they trace their family trees to uncover facts about their heritage. First up is Our Girl actress Michelle Keegan, who discovers the dark story of how her great-grandmother Leonor, who lived on Gibraltar, was evacuated during the Second World War. She then goes further back to her great-great-grandmother, who lived in poverty in Manchester at the start of the 20th century. But as Michelle investigates, she unearths a special connection to the suffragette movement

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing stars Anton Du Beke, Katya Jones and Graziano Di Prima join Nick Knowles and the team in Wallsend, Newcastle. Together, they set to work transforming the True Colours performing arts school, an inclusive dance school that teaches dance and theatre skills to 500 children and young adults weekly, many of whom have disabilities and learning needs. The school has grown substantially over time and they've completely outgrown their existing space, so the team get to work renovating a run-down old boys club that would give the dance school the extra space it so desperately needs to continue to transform more young lives

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Fulham at Craven Cottage and Brighton & Hove Albion v Newcastle United at Amex Stadium. programme.title: The Company You Keep (2012)
programme.desc: A respected lawyer is forced to go on the run when a reporter exposes the truth about him - he is really a member of a radical militant group wanted for questioning in a murder case, who has been living under a fake identity for 30 years. As the fugitive goes in search of his old allies for sanctuary, the reporter delves into his past and uncovers disturbing secrets. Thriller based on the novel by Neil Gordon, directed by and starring Robert Redford, with Shia LaBeouf, Julie Christie and Susan Sarandon

programme.title: Live International T20 Cricket
programme.desc: England v New Zealand. Coverage of the third contest in the four-match series from Edgbaston, Birmingham. programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Judi Dench joins Charlotte Smith in the grounds of Inveraray Castle to reflect on the impact the countryside has had on her and her family. She's also joined by her grandson Sam to check in on a tartan that's being created for her in which every thread tells a personal story. Adam Henson meets her partner David Mills, who gave up dairying to create the British Wildlife Centre on his Surrey farm, while wildlife film-maker Hamza Yassin helps her fulfil a lifetime ambition to see golden eagles in the wild

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Swanage Pier in Dorset where highlights include a famous pantomime dame's costumes, a battered watch with a big price tag and valuable Star Wars memorabilia. programme.title: The Woman in the Wall
programme.desc: A survivor's funeral puts Lorna on edge. programme.desc: Aled Jones explores the extraordinary history and inspirational stories from Canterbury Cathedral, while YolanDa Brown gets up close to some of the 800-year-old stained glass

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers' opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: Live International T20 Cricket
programme.desc: England v New Zealand. Coverage of the third contest in the four-match series from Edgbaston, Birmingham. This is New Zealand's first match here in this format, while England have played four T20s at this venue, winning the first three of them against South Africa, India and Australia, before suffering a 49-run defeat at the hands of the Indians in July 2022

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Judi Dench joins Charlotte Smith in the grounds of Inveraray Castle to reflect on the impact the countryside has had on her and her family. She's also joined by her grandson Sam to check in on a tartan that's being created for her in which every thread tells a personal story. Adam Henson meets her partner David Mills, who gave up dairying to create the British Wildlife Centre on his Surrey farm, while wildlife film-maker Hamza Yassin helps her fulfil a lifetime ambition to see golden eagles in the wild

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Swanage Pier in Dorset where highlights include a famous pantomime dame's costumes, a battered watch with a big price tag and valuable Star Wars memorabilia. Will Farmer challenges Fiona to a guessing game with some of his own Poole Pottery collection that doesn't go entirely to plan

programme.title: The Woman in the Wall
programme.desc: A survivor's funeral puts Lorna on edge. Her sleeplessness is getting to her, but hope comes through unexpected information about Clemence's daughter which might hold the answer to her own child's fate. Colman feels that he has the evidence he needs to place Lorna and Aoife together, until a final showdown with Lorna takes an unexpected turn

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, including Arsenal v Manchester United at Emirates Stadium. Arsenal won last season's corresponding fixture 3-2, and United have found away wins against the top sides hard to come by under Eric Ten Hag. Plus, Liverpool v Aston Villa at Anfield, Crystal Palace v Wolverhampton Wanderers at Selhurst Park and a round-up of Friday and Saturday's goals

programme.title: Children of Men (2006)
programme.desc: In a future blighted by mass infertility, the human race is one generation from extinction and the world has plunged into chaos. In a totalitarian Britain, a jaded former activist tries to protect the first woman to become pregnant in nearly 20 years. However, a militant underground group plans to use her for its own ends. Thriller, starring Clive Owen, Michael Caine and Julianne Moore

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: In Wakefield, a police officer is the victim of a violent attack. Greater Manchester Police tackle knife crime. The RAF are called in to help transatlantic rowers in distress

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: A UK toxicologist uncovers a murder plot when a woman is found dead in an Egyptian hotel room, and a cell communications analyst helps solve the murder of a Northern Irish teacher

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A first-time developer transforms a terrace property in Stoke-on-Trent, while more seasoned developers tackle projects in Leeds and Rugby in Warwickshire. Presented by Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian explores a perplexing mystery at from the Great Wetherby Racecourse Antiques Fair in West Yorkshire. With experts Caroline Hawley and Colin Young

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Daniel has a nasty surprise for Zara, and Claudia learns more about Bear. Meanwhile, Rosie tries to make amends

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore visits Witley recycling centre in Surrey, recovering a wooden cabinet in disrepair, four mixed style chairs and a metal trunk full of vintage tools

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse helps a couple to find a new home closer to their son in Northumbria, and also pays a visit to the Northumberland National Park

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill come up with plans to transform a Liverpool garden into an alpine-themed area suitable for two young children, their ski-loving parents and a dog

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Stephen Mangan on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Eve and Martin learn the truth about Stacey's stalker but Theo intercepts their warning messages to her. Gina humiliates Cindy in the Vic and Ben and Lexi prepare for her first day of secondary school. Lily goes into labour

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Vaping among Britain's teenagers is on the rise and there's growing concern some companies are targeting under-age vapers. So, should we be worried about young people getting addicted? Rachel Burden investigates the youth vaping phenomenon and talks to young people, parents, and experts about how to tackle it

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and a team of ethical hackers hunt down the scammers plaguing people's lives, using cutting-edge technology to monitor fraudsters' phone calls

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: The genealogy documentary follows eight more celebrities as they trace their family trees to uncover facts about their heritage. First up is Our Girl actress Michelle Keegan, who discovers the dark story of how her great-grandmother Leonor, who lived on Gibraltar, was evacuated during the Second World War. She then goes further back to her great-great-grandmother, who lived in poverty in Manchester at the start of the 20th century. But as Michelle investigates, she unearths a special connection to the suffragette movement

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Jailed: Inside Maghaberry Prison
programme.desc: Stephen Nolan enters the notorious high-security Maghaberry Prison to meet the inmates and see for himself the pressures that the system is facing. In the first episode, Stephen talks to a convicted murderer, sees how jail staff try to turn lives around and is confronted by the sometimes shocking reality of life inside

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop are joined by a variety of guest hosts and panellists from the worlds of comedy, journalism and current affairs in this compilation edition revisiting the big news stories of 2022

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present the music-based quiz show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Competing to show off their music knowledge are siblings Mairi and Alastair from Glasgow, mother and daughter Angela and Riziki from Brighton, and couple Mina and Paul from Birmingham and London

programme.title: Abhnichean san Iarmailt/Rivers Above the Canopy
programme.desc: Often considered as the beating heart of the Earth, the trees in the Amazon absorb water from the ground and pump out billion of tons of water vapour a day into vast 'flying rivers', essential to the environmental balance. But what if this natural phenomenon was to disappear? What would be the ecological consequences on our planet? From the Amazon rainforest to some of the world's top laboratories and research centres, and thanks to 3D animation sequences, this scientific investigation deciphers the mechanisms of this extraordinary phenomenon

Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, John Malkovich, Natalie Imbruglia and Ben Miller

programme.title: Waco Untold: The British Stories
programme.desc: Part one of two. A look at the lives of the 23 people from the UK who were among the 82 who died during the siege at the compound of the Branch Davidian religious sect in 1993. This programme weaves together their intimate and emotional stories through the testimonies of their loved ones and survivors of the fire, many of whom are speaking here for the first time

programme.title: DNA Journey
programme.desc: Sisters Oti and Motsi Mabuse head on a journey across their homeland of South Africa to explore their extraordinary family history. The sisters have tried to explore their history before, but with records for black South Africans almost non-existent, going on their DNA journey is the last roll of the dice to discover their roots. Beginning their journey just north of Johannesburg, the sisters are delighted to connect with their cousin Samantha, who reveals their familial link to an African Royal family. Later, the pair trace other branches of their family line and discover a brave ancestor who fought in World War Two, before finding out they are also related to the famous South African musician, Hotstix Mabuse

programme.title: DNA Journey
programme.desc: Sisters Oti and Motsi Mabuse head on a journey across their homeland of South Africa to explore their extraordinary family history. The sisters have tried to explore their history before, but with records for black South Africans almost non-existent, going on their DNA journey is the last roll of the dice to discover their roots. Beginning their journey just north of Johannesburg, the sisters are delighted to connect with their cousin Samantha, who reveals their familial link to an African Royal family. Later, the pair trace other branches of their family line and discover a brave ancestor who fought in World War Two, before finding out they are also related to the famous South African musician, Hotstix Mabuse

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Dour DI Jack Frost suspects a man he arrested years before for a series of bizarre assaults on children could have returned to the area and recommenced his unsavoury activities. Starring David Jason, Peter Gunn, Susannah Doyle, Bruce Alexander, John Lyons and Gwyneth Powell

programme.title: Carry On Behind (1975)
programme.desc: Professors Ronald Crump and Anna Vooshka embark on an archaeological dig, but find their efforts disrupted by the saucy shenanigans of a motley bunch of holiday-makers in the neighbouring caravan park. Comedy, starring Kenneth Williams, Elke Sommer, Joan Sims, Windsor Davies, Kenneth Connor and Bernard Bresslaw

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo visit a resort in Spain to create a trophy garden for a pro-am tennis tournament run by a former champion. When one of the competitors is found dead, everyone assumes it to be a gruesome accident - but there is more to the case than meets the eye. While investigating, Laura enters the mysterious world of bullfighting, and Rosemary rediscovers her love of motor scooters

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered amateur detectives work on a garden for an open-air theatre, where Rosemary's cousin is due to perform. However, the production suffers a setback when an actor shoots himself during rehearsal - and the gun is found to have contained live bullets instead of blanks. A member of the cast gets an attack of stage fright, and Laura is obliged to take her place in the play as the duo try to find the culprit. Drama, with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An actress engaged to marry a foreign prince becomes the police's number one suspect in the murder of a shady producer. Desperate to ensure she escapes prosecution, her wealthy fiance asks Poirot to catch the real killer. Unfortunately, the celebrated detective ends up concluding she has lied - or is an accomplice. David Suchet stars, with Niamh Cusack, Abigail Cruttenden and Sean Pertwee

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A well-known eccentric contacts the Belgian sleuth when he is haunted by suicidal nightmares. However, he fails to follow Poirot's advice, and is found dead soon afterwards. Drama, starring David Suchet, with Joely Richardson and Mary Tamm

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Part one of two. Poirot meets a woman who has seemingly become unaccountably accident-prone - but soon starts to suspect she is actually a victim of foul play

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Part two of two. Poirot meets a woman who has seemingly become unaccountably accident-prone - but soon starts to suspect she is actually a victim of foul play

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Forest ranger Felicity Ward is blinded by mysterious lights while driving at night in the village of Cooper Hill and the next morning her car is found abandoned at the roadside, followed closely by the discovery of her body. Visiting UFO spotters in the village are convinced aliens are responsible, but as Barnaby and Nelson try to get to the truth, they unearth suspicions, betrayals and long-buried secrets along the way. Michelle Collins, Steve Evets, Alison Steadman, Steve Oram and Pip Torrens guest star

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An international cycling competition comes to the Midsomer village of Burwood Mantle, but when the race leader is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson must investigate. During the race's finale, the victim overtook his team-mate to win, leaving the team owner annoyed that he disobeyed his orders, and the rival manager disappointed that his team lost. However, as the pair look into the case, they find themselves drawn into a competitive world of blackmail, bribery and bloodshed, where winning comes at any cost

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Art comes to the Midsomer village of Angel's Rise with the opening of a new sculpture park, but when its launch is marred by murder, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson are called to investigate. However, they must deal with an apparently unexplainable broken locket found near the scene of the crime, a host of suspects, and a complex web of deception. As the crime solving duo inspect further, they find they have to get creative to solve a case where art imitates death and everything has a deeper meaning

programme.title: Ridley
programme.desc: After a chance encounter with jazz singer Eve Marbury, the former detective agrees to help find her brother, who has been missing for 40 years. When a woman is found dead, dark secrets that have been buried for decades begin to emerge. Crime drama, starring Adrian Dunbar

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Troubled saleswoman Helen (Nicola Walker), whose mother was murdered back in episode one, turns up on Janet's doorstep with information that takes the investigation in a completely different direction - paving the way for the formidable Det Supt Julie Dodson to be called in. Meanwhile, new recruit Sgt Rob Waddington arrives on the scene - putting Janet's nose out of joint as she is demoted back down to constable. Emmerdale star Danny Miller (Aaron Livesy) joins the cast

programme.title: Carry On Follow That Camel (1967)
