Comedy, starring Phil Silvers, Jim Dale, Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Peter Butterworth, Bernard Bresslaw and Joan Sims

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective is summoned to a hotel by a mysterious veiled lady who tells him that her forthcoming marriage is under threat because she is being blackmailed over a love letter. Drama, starring David Suchet and Frances Barber

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is asked to investigate the disappearance of a bank's most valued customer, who had been planning to sell the chairman a map showing where to find a long-lost silver mine. David Suchet stars

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A dentist falls in love with his young assistant. His anxious wife, believing he has made plans to poison her and thereby remove the main obstacle to happiness, calls for Poirot's help. Drama, starring David Suchet

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A wealthy banker goes missing while walking from his country house to the village post office. Poirot, who has acquired a parrot and developed a taste for conjuring tricks, bets the baffled Inspector Japp £5 he can solve the mystery without leaving his own apartment. David Suchet stars

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The detective suspects a connection between the death of a student with secret plans for advancement and the killing of well-known criminal Nicky Turnbull, who was in Oxford to speak at the Union. As Lewis and Hathaway eliminate suspects from a long list of the crook's enemies, the investigation brings him into contact with old flame Diane - who also happens to be Turnbull's wife. Kevin Whately stars, with Laurence Fox and Gina McKee

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Green-fingered amateur detectives Laura and Rosemary are called in to tackle a stubborn species of weed threatening an entire year's vintage at the Crickle Valley vineyard. However, they find themselves in the right place at the right time when the body of a wine critic is discovered on the premises. Murder mystery, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Dad's Army (2016)
programme.desc: The officious captain of a seaside town's home guard platoon tries to maintain the reputation and morale of his troops as the Second World War draws to a close. He finds himself dealing with the hunt for a German spy as well as a female journalist sent to report on the exploits of the brave but bumbling soldiers. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Toby Jones, Bill Nighy and Catherine Zeta-Jones

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Morse investigates the disappearance of a teacher from a secretive public school, and begins to question who he can trust when a body is discovered. Thursday wrestles with the imminent closure of Cowley Station as he tries to find the vital evidence that will connect Eddie Nero to a series of unsolved murders, and assigns Fancy to track down the man who may be the key to cracking the case

programme.title: Blue Murder
programme.desc: Detective and single mother Janine Lewis fears she will struggle to balance her responsibilities as she returns to work following maternity leave. However, she soon gets back into the swing of things as she investigates the murder of a lap-dancer - who just happened to work for a man involved in a hit-and-run accident. Ian Kelsey co-stars

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A body is found buried on the Northumberland moors which could be a missing teenager from the nearby rural community of Brindale. The girl had disappeared six weeks previously, and Vera has to break the news to her devastated family. However, the realisation that she died so close to home rather than at a music festival as originally thought creates tension among her neighbours, who are soon suspecting each other of murder. The detective delves into the vulnerable young woman's isolated existence to identify her killer

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade continues his investigations into supposedly deadly freshwater creatures. From right across the Amazon there are stories of a colossal fish that is said to swallow men whole. Some call it the 'lau-lau', others the 'piraiba'. But after 20 years of criss-crossing South America, Jeremy has never seen a specimen big enough to convince him that the fishermen's tales are true. In this programme, he heads to a remote and little-known backwater of Guyana on a mission to finally track down this alleged monster

Western, starring John Wayne and Forrest Tucker

The stage will culminate on Deansgate in the heart of Manchester city centre, the scene of a memorable victory from recently-crowned world champion Mathieu van der Poel that saw him clinch overall Tour of Britain glory four years ago. Presented by Matt Barbet with commentary from Ned Boulting and David Millar

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Hundreds died when the Sobral Santos II capsized not far from the shores of the Amazon in September 1981, and many of the stricken passengers were reportedly dragged to their deaths by powerful unseen attackers. Freshwater detective Jeremy Wade attempts to identify the culprits that played a part in the river's worst-ever boating disaster, but has the trail gone cold after more than 30 years?

programme.title: Monster Carp
programme.desc: Ali Hamidi, Tom Dove and Neil Spooner head to Italy and travel to a lake in the hills near Bologna, where they have just two days to catch a whopper. Then it is off for the main event at a large water called Viverone, not far from the Alps, where they go up against fish with a reputation for outwitting anglers

programme.title: 633 Squadron (1964)
programme.desc: British airmen embark on a daring mission to destroy a heavily fortified German rocket-fuel plant in Norway, and to ensure success the RAF pilots have to bomb an overhanging cliff to collapse it onto the building. The plan threatens to unravel, however, when a Norwegian freedom fighter plotting a land attack to coincide with the air strike is captured by the Nazis. Second World War drama, starring Cliff Robertson, George Chakiris, Donald Houston and Harry Andrews

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.desc: Christian and Mandy, the organisers of the annual Pride festival, are 4,000 euros short of the 18,000 required to stage the weekend-long party - and if that were not bad enough, the costumes are seven sizes too big. With two weeks left, can the duo save the day? Cameras also follow bar owner Cath as she prepares to host a hen party for 14 excited Northern Irish women and Leeds lad Peter, who publishes a free pocket guide to the Costa del Sol

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Mandy and Christian's Pride parade finally arrives, but what begins as a stressful day only gets worse when the generator powering the speakers packs up. Can the duo turn things around or will the the revellers be expected to dance to a silent soundtrack? Meanwhile, cockney limo driver Johnny Diamond books two big jobs on the same night, and Bury couple Andy and Sue settle in to their static caravan in the Spanish countryside

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: A new arrival in Saydo Park discovers the joys of drag at the age of 66, while a family running a British convenience store needs to make some money to move to a bigger home. Pub owners Sarah and Simon take a group of their regulars on a cliffside walk through the El Chorro gorge, here one of the party has to confront her fear of heights

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jane explores more of what Australia has to offer, beginning in the hotspot Surfer's Paradise - although her hopes of taking to the waves are dashed when an unexpected storm hits. She does, however, have a go at indoor skydiving and tries various relaxation therapies before heading to the west coast, where she begins her cruise on the ship featured in the remake of cult TV show The Love Boat. Also on the itinerary are visits to the war memorials of Albany, the starting point of the Anzac campaign in the First World War, and Fremantle Prison, where she heads into spooky underground tunnels built by prisoners

programme.title: When Holidays Go Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: Accounts of nightmare vacations from those whose dream break went horribly wrong, including a woman horrified to see her young children paddling in what she believed to be sewage. Plus, the beachgoer who found herself upside down and clinging on for dear life during a parasailing excursion we Horribly Wrong, and a day trip to Brighton that ended up a sunseeker being chased by a hungry flock of seagulls. Jenny Powell narrates, with contributors including broadcaster Dermot Murnaghan, travel journalist Simon Calder and DJ Sonny Jay

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Before They Were Royal
programme.desc: A profile of the socialite, focusing on her early years before she met the future Edward VIII, asking whether she was a scheming seductress or one of the most maligned women in history. Her first marriage, to a heavy-drinking US naval officer, was a tempestuous on-off relationship, and in 1928, she married her first British husband, Ernest Aldrich Simpson, an English-American shipping executive. However, it wasn't until three years later that she was introduced to the Prince of Wales at an event at Burrough Court - a meeting that was to spark an infamous period in British history

programme.title: Philip: Elizabeth's One & Only
programme.desc: A profile of King Charles' father, exploring how he dealt with giving up his promising naval career and his surname as he took a back seat to his wife Elizabeth II. From his charity patronages, to founding the Duke of Edinburgh Award and becoming an unlikely champion of environmental issues, his life as Britain's longest-serving royal consort was a significant one for the entire nation

programme.title: Buckingham Palace with Alexander Armstrong
programme.desc: The actor examines the history of the residence from just before the outbreak of the Second World War to the present and looks at what the future holds. Raksha Dave examines a memoir written by George VI's family nanny that lifted the lid on the reality of life in the palace, while JJ Chalmers takes cover in an air-raid shelter just like the one in Buckingham Palace's cellar to find out how it survived the Blitz.

programme.title: Top of the Box
programme.desc: Matthew Kelly takes a look back at the most popular TV shows of 1989. The stars of Bread reflect on filming their Christmas special, Neighbours star Mark Little recalls how Australian soaps took British TV by storm, and Byker Grove star Lyndyann Barrass explores the year's best children's programmes. Other shows featured include Only Fools and Horses, The Bill, 'Allo 'Allo! and Birds of a Feather

programme.title: Scandal: The Major-Currie Affair
programme.desc: The story of how Edwina Currie shocked the nation when she revealed in her diaries that she and former prime minister John Major had embarked on an affair between 1984 and 1988. The programme using first-hand testimonies, archive footage and dramatic reconstruction to examine what led the MPS to succumb to their base desires, with contemporaries, journalists and comedians bringing their own perspectives to the tale

programme.title: Britain's Great Cathedrals with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: Built more than 1,400 years ago, Canterbury Cathedral is both a holy place and a World Heritage site. It is the 'mother church' for more than 85 million people, and one of the biggest tourist attractions in the UK with nearly a million visitors a year. Tony tells the tale of the cathedral's founding and how, after the cathedral burnt down, it was rebuilt by the Normans as a symbol of their power. He also explores how it became wealthy thanks to its role as a major site of pilgrimage following the infamous murder of Archbishop Thomas Becket

programme.title: Britain's Great Cathedrals with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: In one of the biggest engineering projects of the Middle Ages, Salisbury Cathedral was moved from a wind-blasted Iron Age hill fort to its current location - a feat accomplished in just 38 years, helping establish the Wiltshire city in the process. A place of both ancient tradition and home to one of the country's oldest choirs, Tony witnesses the ritual of inducting a new chorister and sees the oldest working clock in the world. The presenter also reflects on the cathedral's role in a clandestine operation that helped turn the tide of the Second World War

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow examines the work of Italian Renaissance painter Raffaello Santi, known better simply as Raphael, who was born in 1483 and achieved so much in his 37-year life that he was considered equal to Leonardo da Vinci and Michelangelo. He was highly regarded for his many studies of the Madonna and Child, and artists adopted his idealised forms as the model of beauty until the end of the 19th century

programme.desc: Steve Backshall, Miranda Krestovnikoff, Bill Oddie and Lindsey Chapman present from their base in Northumberland's Kielder Forest as they join forces with animal experts to examine what can be done to ease the pressures on UK wildlife. In the opening episode, Peter Wright of The Yorkshire Vet fame tries to shed light on why so many seabirds have disappeared in the last 50 years. Along the way, he is treated to the sight of gannets diving for fish off Bempton Cliffs on the east coast

programme.title: Britain's Great Cathedrals with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: The actor and presenter visits Durham cathedral, one of Britain's first Unesco World Heritage sites and a leading tourist attraction. The cathedral is over 900 years old and built like a fortress. It is 218ft tall and when first constructed was the country's tallest building. The bishops at Durham were so powerful that they were given the title Prince-Bishop to reflect their huge wealth and influence. As well as exploring the Norman edifice, Tony meets a modern-day treasure hunter who has discovered hidden lost treasures from the cathedral in the River Wear

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow reveals how the Renaissance movement found a new centre in Venice and examines the life and work of Tiziano Vecellio, known to English-speakers as Titian, who pioneered the use of oils with a radical approach to light, colour and brush strokes. His talent was recognised across Europe and he painted portraits of some of the 16th century's most powerful figures, including Pope Paul III and Charles V of Spain

Comedy, with Lee Pace, and featuring the voice of Owen Wilson

programme.title: Ferdinand (2017)
programme.desc: After a bull with a big heart is mistaken for a dangerous beast, he is captured and torn from his home. Determined to return to his family, he rallies a misfit team on the ultimate adventure. Animated comedy, with the voices of John Cena, Kate McKinnon and Bobby Cannavale

programme.title: Time Bandits (1981)
programme.desc: A bemused schoolboy is escorted on a bizarre journey through time by a group of larcenous dwarfs. His adventures lead him to encounters with various characters from history - but none of them are quite what he had imagined. Terry Gilliam's fantasy comedy, starring Craig Warnock, David Rappaport, John Cleese, Michael Palin, Sean Connery, Ian Holm, Ralph Richardson and David Warner

programme.title: Titanic (1997)
programme.desc: A party of explorers studying the sunken remains of the famous liner meets an elderly woman who was a passenger on the ill-fated maiden voyage. She recounts how she boarded the ship while on the brink of being forced into marriage by her family, and was stopped from killing herself by a penniless artist. She fell in love with her saviour, but the disaster on the horizon meant their time together was doomed to be short. James Cameron's Oscar-winning romantic drama, starring Kate Winslet, Leonardo DiCaprio, Billy Zane, Kathy Bates and Bill Paxton

programme.title: The Bone Collector (1999)
programme.desc: A quadriplegic ex-cop is saved from the brink of suicide by a rookie female officer needing his expertise to form a psychological profile of a serial killer. The murderer is posing as a cab driver and terrorising Manhattan, and has a gruesome habit of taking trophies from his victims' bodies. Thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Angelina Jolie, Michael Rooker, Mike McGlone, Luis Guzman and Queen Latifah

programme.title: The Great Debaters (2007)
programme.desc: A politically radical professor at an all-black college from the Deep South in the racially segregated 1930s organises his students into a successful debate team. He leads them through a historic run of victories in the face of prejudice, leading to a contest with Harvard University's national champions. Fact-based drama, directed by and starring Denzel Washington. With Forest Whitaker

programme.title: She, A Chinese (2009)
programme.desc: A restless woman leaves her dull life in a small Chinese village in search of excitement, but ends getting drawn into organised crime. When her gangster lover is killed, she flees China for England, where she enters into a marriage of convenience. Drama, starring Huang Lu and We Yi Bo. In Mandarin and English

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army (1960)
programme.desc: A naval officer is given the command of an old sailing ship to undertake a very important mission - to transport an Australian agent into enemy waters so he can spy on the Japanese. However, he finds the ship is falling apart at the seams and is manned by a crew that does not know how to sail her. Second World War comedy, with Jack Lemmon, Ricky Nelson, John Lund, Chips Rafferty and Tom Tully

programme.title: Captain Scarlett (1953)
programme.desc: A brave nobleman forms a band of outlaws to free 19th-century French villagers from the tyranny of an evil duke, reclaim his birthright and save a lovely princess from a fate worse than death at the hands of a lecherous count. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Richard Greene, Leonora Amar, Nedrick Young and Manolo Fabregas

programme.title: Carry On Cabby (1963)
programme.desc: The neglected wife of a workaholic taxi owner grows increasingly tired of his lack of interest in their marriage. In a ploy to bring him to his senses, she secretly launches a rival cab firm with a driver roster made up of attractive women, who soon tempt his customers away. Comedy, starring Sid James, Hattie Jacques, Kenneth Connor and Charles Hawtrey

programme.title: Von Ryan's Express (1965)
programme.desc: A courageous American colonel with a never-say-die attitude is held in a PoW camp. He boldly sets out to lead a group of Allied prisoners in a daring mass escape bid by hijacking a freight train and fleeing through occupied Italy to Switzerland. Second World War action adventure, starring Frank Sinatra, Trevor Howard, Brad Dexter and James Brolin

programme.title: Finding Your Feet (2017)
programme.desc: A wealthy woman's privileged existence is shattered when she discovers her husband is having an affair with her best friend. Seeking solace, she turns to her estranged sister, who lives in a London council estate, and finds a new lease of life in joining her community dance class. Comedy, starring Imelda Staunton, Celia Imrie, Timothy Spall and Joanna Lumley

programme.title: Flight (2012)
programme.desc: An airline pilot with a history of heavy drinking and drug use successfully lands a plane that suffers mechanical problems during a fierce storm, saving the lives of nearly everyone on board. While initially hailed as a hero, it later emerges that he was drunk at the time, raising questions about whether he may have contributed to the disaster rather than averted it. Drama, starring Denzel Washington and Don Cheadle

programme.title: Fences (2016)
programme.desc: Adaptation of the August Wilson play about a working-class African-American dad trying to raise his family in the 1950s, while coming to terms with the events of his life. Directed by and starring Denzel Washington, with an Oscar-winning Viola Davis

programme.title: The Fits (2015)
programme.desc: Eleven-year-old Toni becomes entranced with a tight-knit dance team in Cincinnati's West End. Enamoured by the power and confidence of this strong community of girls, she eagerly absorbs routines, masters drills and even pierces her own ears to fit in. A mysterious outbreak of fainting spells plagues the team, and Toni finds herself caught up in danger as her desire for acceptance is twisted. Drama, starring Royalty Hightower and Alexis Neblett

programme.title: Lego Masters New Zealand
programme.desc: The four remaining teams must build an emotional work of art made entirely from just one colour, creating a sculpture good enough for an art gallery

programme.desc: Mark-Francis faces a decision as Tom treats him to an attractive starter, main and dessert, while Adam and Lottie come together after their latest dates for a make-or-break talk

programme.title: Below Deck Sailing Yacht
programme.desc: Paget's patience runs out when he is left to pick up the slack after Parsifal crashes into the dock, while Madison must decide how to handle a charter guest who crossed the line

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: First episode of the comedy, focusing on an 11-year-old boy as he captures his family on video camera during the 1980s. Barry wants to start driving on his 16th birthday, but Beverly advises against it and refuses to allow Pops to sell him his old car. Starring Jeff Garlin, Troy Gentile and Wendi McLendon-Covey

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: A day at the roller-skating rink leaves Murray wishing he had not asked Erica to tell him about her life, while Pops steps in to help when a back-to-school shopping trip causes problems between Beverly and Adam. Comedy, starring Jeff Garlin, Wendi McLendon-Covey and Hayley Orrantia

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: As Dre's sister Rhonda prepares to marry her girlfriend Sharon, Rainbow reveals she is against the patriarchal convention of taking a man's last name. Jack and Diane worry that they're too old to be the ring bearer and flower girl, while Andre Jr and Zoey prepare Ruby to embrace her daughter's relationship

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: When news spreads that Stevens & Lido is going to lay off some staff, Dre panics that his family's reputation will be tarnished if he loses his job. Rainbow has something to prove when she's put in charge of the school auction and refuses to ask the other mothers for help, enlisting the children instead

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire becomes a neighbourhood vigilante in the hope of stopping a motorist who has begun speeding through local streets. Jay teaches Manny to ride a bike, before discovering Gloria also needs lessons, while Mitch and Cameron befriend zany stranger Barry. Guest starring James Marsden (X-Men)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped Investigates
programme.desc: Kate Quilton investigates the 2019 listeria outbreak in UK hospitals that left six dead and asks if enough is being done to protect vulnerable patients from a failing food safety system. She meets scientists to uncover just what listeria is and how the outbreak happened, goes inside a hospital kitchen to see first-hand how food is made and speaks with an anonymous government whistleblower who reveals cutbacks could mean another deadly outbreak will happen again

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mel, David and their daughters are relocating from North Shields to the picturesque town of La Duquesa on Spain's Costa del Sol. Danni Menzies helps them find the perfect property with a pool for their £160,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Folk dancer Gay and drama teacher Stephen are relocating to Finistère in the north west of France, where they love the rugged coastline and beautiful medieval villages. Laura Hamilton lines up five properties for their £100,000 budget, hoping at least one will be just what they are looking for

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to the Borgue Hotel in Dumfries and Galloway, which owners Vince and Shirley Barrett run with military precision. On arrival, guests Adam and Naomi are not impressed with the decor, while Ken and Elaine do not like the orange towels. Later, over dinner, the hosts reveal who wears the trousers in their relationship, before Ken's jokes go down like a lead balloon

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Allscott Mill B&B in Telford, Shropshire, on their second night, where hosts Ken and Elaine Purchase welcome their guests. On arrival, Shirely and Vince find fault with the lack of headroom in their lodgings, while Adam and Naomi are bemused by the absence of a toilet brush in their bathroom

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Park House in Llandrindod Wells, Powys, where owners Ian and Joan Barr hope their colourful B&B will impress their guests. Adam and Naomi are wowed by the vibrant decor, but Ken and Elaine take issue with a dirty toilet brush

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Naomi and Adam Black welcome the contestants to East Thorne yurt retreat in Bude, Cornwall. They are pleased to discover it is Vince and Shirley's dream location, but Ken and Elaine don't share the same opinion. Later, the guests take part in an archery competition, and in the morning, are unimpressed with the DIY breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rival owners meet for the final time on the last day of the competition to find out what they've been paid and settle some scores. Hosting skills, breakfasts, facilities and two toilet brush gripes are aired before the cash is counted and the winner is announced

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with two house-hunters who were searching for properties in 2002. They revisit anaesthetist Ian from Cheltenham, who was looking for a Regency property, and single mum Sehyr from Windsor, who was after a Victorian style home

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: In a series first, guest judge Philip Khoury, Harrods' head pastry chef, surprises the semi-finalists and sets their first challenge - his signature Dawn of a New Day dessert. In the second challenge the teams must create a miniature village scene complete with enough bûche entremet and edible elements to serve 40 guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: in Cardiff, DJ Trishna hopes her cooking will be even better than her rapping, as she hosts a hip-hop themed night in a bid to scoop the £1000 prize. However, when Yuno shakes his booty on the dance floor, opera-loving Nick is unimpressed and flirty Michelle lets her hands do the talking

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the second day of the competition in Cardiff and Nick is planning to bring some refinement and fine dining to the week's proceedings. However, fastidious Nick really has set himself a mountain to climb with a massive tasting menu

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the third day in Cardiff, retail manager Yuno hopes to scoop the prize by whisking his guests off to the Himalayas. As well as entertaining his guests with some traditional dancing, Yuno's also hoping to tickle their taste buds by serving up Nepalese food

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's day four of the competition in Cardiff and turn of self-appointed 'hostess with the mostest' Michelle. She's out to impress with a culinary trip around the world, but when she sets a fun challenge, she ends up being accused of cheating

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night of the competition in Cardiff, host Suzanne is pinning her hopes on an evening of sophistication and fine French cuisine. Suzanne's menu is inspired by her many holidays to France - in fact she's been every year for the last 17 years. However, revealing the inspiration behind her starter might be a step too far for her guests, especially after the revelations found inside her 'special' cupboard!

programme.title: Remarkable Places to Eat
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix explores south Devon with chef Angela Hartnett, visiting a restaurant in Dartmouth with a reputation for serving some of the UK's finest seafood. They also board a boat to the River Exe Café, a floating restaurant in the middle of the River Exe, and visit an independent restaurant in Totnes

programme.title: Bettany Hughes' Treasures of the World
programme.desc: Bettany explores mountainous Albania, and journeys to epic fortress towns, breath-taking archaeological sites and encounters a richly diverse history and culture. She visits the ancient city of Butrint, meets remote communities in the spectacular Albanian Alps, and goes underground to the secret bunker of former communist dictator Enver Hoxha

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The documentary follows the work of the stroke team at south London's King's College Hospital. Laura's family faces a big decision when the 72-year-old grandmother is found to have a blood clot on her brain, while father-of-three Nic, the over-40s National BMX Champion, collapses in reception after suffering an accident while training for a stunt. The medics also treat 83-year-old Marjorie, who is complaining of a pain behind her eye following a recent bout of shingles

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Brian, 74, is brought into King's by ambulance after falling backwards down a flight of stairs and being knocked unconscious at his partner's house. Sylvester arrives in paediatric A&E with his two-year-old son, who has cut his forehead on a visit to church, while 70-year-old builder Leonard has lost sensation down his left side and the medics are worried he may have suffered a stroke

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts, as Roisin Conaty and Asim Chaudhry take on Jon Richardson and Josh Widdicombe. Bill Bailey is in Dictionary Corner. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts as Lee Mack and Joe Wilkinson take on Jon Richardson and Jessica Knappett. Comedian Nigel Ng is in Dictionary Corner. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The documentary follows the work of the stroke team at south London's King's College Hospital. Laura's family faces a big decision when the 72-year-old grandmother is found to have a blood clot on her brain, while father-of-three Nic, the over-40s National BMX Champion, collapses in reception after suffering an accident while training for a stunt. The medics also treat 83-year-old Marjorie, who is complaining of a pain behind her eye following a recent bout of shingles

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Brian, 74, is brought into King's by ambulance after falling backwards down a flight of stairs and being knocked unconscious at his partner's house. Sylvester arrives in paediatric A&E with his two-year-old son, who has cut his forehead on a visit to church, while 70-year-old builder Leonard has lost sensation down his left side and the medics are worried he may have suffered a stroke

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Geri Melville is originally from St Lucia, but moved to the UK when she was just nine. Now, she's ready to return to her roots with her husband Ian, by buying a holiday home together on the island she left almost 50 years ago. With a budget of £360,000 Laura Hamilton shows them five properties boasting views of the Caribbean Sea

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets Devon woman Tabitha, who is using a horsebox to build a mobile juice bar for the second time after her first one was stolen. He also continues his tour of New Zealand's amazing spaces, and he and Will Hardie's futuristic rotating home takes a giant leap forward

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: George visits Lucas and Hayley, whose bland and boxy 1970s four-bedroom home sticks out like a sore thumb among the period properties of Saffron Walden, Essex. To make matters worse, some 1980s interior additions have added insult to injury - and the double garage at the side is next to useless. Enter architect Chris Dyson to bring the property bang up to date. But will Lucas and Hayley be happy with his radical plans?

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The architect tries to unlock the potential of old properties. He starts out in Stroud, where Phil and Leighla are transforming their ramshackle, listed Georgian farmhouse with an industrial-style extension. George also pays a visit to Wootton Bassett, where he helps a couple flip the layout of their Victorian end-of-terrace home

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the first dinner date in Middlesbrough glamorous 41-year-old sales assistant Gail hosts a night full of sparkly gourmet grub and teaches her guests a lesson or two in beauty. Her guests are 52-year-old vintage shop owner Jane, 28-year-old football coach Dan, 57-year-old art enthusiast Julie and 47-year-old pub landlord Gary. Gail gets the glitter, sparklers and hair extensions out, but whether her food will get glowing reviews ramins to be seen

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Goalkeeping coach Dan hopes to thrill his guests with a James Bond evening in Middlesbrough, including 007-inspired food and a Bond villain. however, Julie and Jane fail to 'bond' on the night, falling out over everything from who's been the best James Bond, to how to pronounce Roger Moore. Gary and Gail also fall out when the table chat turns to 'lookey-likeys'. After dinner, Dan challenges his guests to put one past him in a penalty shoot-out, which ends with a surprising result

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Middlesbrough, pub landlord Gary plans a 1980s evening, serving classic dishes with a modern twist. However, Jane and Julie are still bickering and Gary falls out with Gail over his dessert. Showman Gary flambés his steaks at the table, and tops things off with a magic display that goes down well with all of his guests - except one

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Vintage shop owner Jane serves up a retro menu and a vintage clothes competition in Middlesbrough. Jane's been on the attack at the table so far, but she's planning to be the perfect host this time. On a lively night, there's more drama between the diners, and Julie and Gail discover that Jane has created headlines in the local news

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the last night in Middlesbrough, Julie's Indian menu gets mixed reviews, while Gail and Jane make a shoe discovery that leads to some shocking dinner table revelations. Gary finds out how much he's got on Jane's nerves throughout the week, as the contestants candidly reveal what they think of each other

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Worcestershire, where friends Geri Atterbury and Lorraine Rigby invite guests to stay at Greenways of Malvern. On arrival, couple Sean McGahern and Maxine Parker are not impressed by the wild wallpaper, and the lack of an en-suite dismays mother-and-son duo Sarah and Luke Allaway

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Royal Forester at Bewdley in Worcestershire for their second stay, with proprietors Sean McGahern and Maxine Parker hoping to impress their guests with a trip to a local safari park. Sarah and Luke are impressed with their colourful room, but Sanjeev and Elinor have a 'hairy' experience

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: From Ferry Lodge in Holyhead, Anglesey, where mother-and-son duo Sarah and Luke Allaway hope to impress the other contestants. However, things do not get off to a good start when Geri and Lorraine are overwhelmed by the number of laminated signs, Sean and Maxine begrudge paying 50p for toiletries and Sanjeev and Elinor are left unimpressed by the cleanliness of the establishment

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Partners Sanjeev Bhagotra and Elinor Roberts welcome their guests to Court Colman Manor, Bridgend, Glamorgan. Sean McGahern and Maxine Parker are pleased with the size of their room on arrival, but Sarah Allaway discovers a collection of cobwebs in hers. During the afternoon, the groups take a lesson in fire-making, and the next morning a traditional Welsh breakfast is not to everyone's taste - with the hosts wondering whether tactical voting has played a part come feedback time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet one last time to find out what they have been paid. Geri kicks off proceedings by demanding to know why Sarah and Luke did not want a return visit to Greenways of Malvern, before they in turn confront Sanjeev and Elinor over their low cleanliness score for Ferry Lodge. Then the Court Colman Manor proprietors accuse Sarah and Luke of unfairly judging their hotel, before the payments are revealed and the winners are announced

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In the Manchester area, 27-year-old full-time mum Johanna, plans an evening dedicated to takeways from Turkey to China and India. Her guests are 34-year-old lorry driver Ryan, 48-year-old housewife Fiona, 45-year-old laundrette owner Linzi and 53-year-old translator Nico, on a night that includes a sojourn into Shakespeare

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Manchester, lorry-driving movie buff Ryan plans a film-inspired menu including his 'Prawn Identity' starter, 'Sausage Meat the Fockers' and 'Chocolate Clockwork Orange' desert. Unfortunately the first course is more of a disaster movie for Johanna, who has to face her fear of prawns. Meanwhile, Nico puts the cat among the pigeons with his views on male chefs and Fiona takes Linzi to task over her beauty regime

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Glamorous 'domestic delegator' Fiona aims to impress with a classy but effortless menu as she hosts the third dinner party of the week in the Manchester area. However, critical Linzi takes issue with Fiona's mother chopping her vegetables and her cousin making her honeycomb. Then, there's more trouble brewing as Nico and Johanna clash

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Critical laundrette owner Linzi has been a hard taskmaster all week in the Manchester area, so expects to show her guests where they've been going wrong. She's not pleased when Ryan questions her choice of starter. When the guests find out what Linzi does for a job, Nico struggles to understand the concept of a laundrette. Self-proclaimed domestic delegator Fiona has to face her fears during Linzi's entertainment - an ironing competition

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in the Manchester area, Nico plans to show the Brits how it's done in the kitchen with his Italian cooking. He's been talking up his Italian heritage all week, and Linzi's convinced he's heading for a fall. Ryan's shocked by some of Nico's locker-room tales, while baby of the group Johanna horrifies the other female contestants with her thoughts on gender politics. It remains to be seen who will pick up the £1,000 prize

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics get a category one call to a child who's struggling to breathe and a drunk man outside a police station refuses to move, putting himself at risk for hypothermia

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Ellen, 86, has been brought in by ambulance after her daughters found her collapsed at home. Her body temperature has dropped dangerously low and she's also lost five pints of blood. Meanwhile, appendicitis is suspected when 75-year-old Martin is rushed in with severe abdominal pain, and neurologists perform tests to determine whether 70-year-old mother-of-10 Lula has suffered a stroke

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: Dr Mark assembles a crack team to save a man with life-threatening gunshot wounds. Dr Jonathan suspects that a surfing coach who's been in a horror crash has a shattered leg

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Compilation episode of the most dramatic incidents the medics have dealt with, including a man who had to be put into an induced coma after a freak car accident, a woman trapped in her car and a crash on a country road that required the helicopter medics to be diverted from a training mission

programme.title: The Good Doctor
programme.desc: A patient with anorexia cannot gain enough weight to survive heart surgery, so Claire suggests an alternative. Shaun worries about Glassman's refusal to walk the hospital floor

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: Dr Mark assembles a crack team to save a man with life-threatening gunshot wounds. Dr Jonathan suspects that a surfing coach who's been in a horror crash has a shattered leg

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

Meanwhile, appendicitis is suspected when 75-year-old Martin is rushed in with severe abdominal pain, and neurologists perform tests to determine whether 70-year-old mother-of-10 Lula has suffered a stroke

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Guy and Julie Sadler from Brighton have travelled all around the world together and have long dreamed of relocating somewhere warm. Now, although they've never been to Spain, they've decided that Almería has the perfect balance of sunshine and affordable property. Laura Hamilton shows them five homes for their £100,000 budget

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Sharron Davies and Tanni Grey-Thompson face the stopwatch once more as they battle to complete personalised slogan banners

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Edinburgh couple David and Venus share a passion for Portugal, so would like a holiday home in the Algarve. Jasmine Harman lines up five properties for their £95,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Two ex-casino employees start a new life in Portugal's Algarve running a restaurant, while a horse lover from Somerset prepares to move to Italy to open a pony-trekking business

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien hope a clay pigeon trap, a searchlight and a Peugeot 205 will help make a profit for their owners

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel to East Sussex in their hunt to discover valuable items 'lost' in people's homes, with their finds including some Victorian street lamps

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Research into family trees uncovers the history of domestic service in one of the world's most prestigious universities and how luxury transatlantic steamliners helped change the course of history. Plus, details of unclaimed estates with heirs still needing to be found

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Tower View Hotel, in Blackpool, where owner Jennifer McGirr is joined by friend Diana Carnegie. Daniel Walker and George Gillespie find some unwanted guests in the bathroom and trouble arises at breakfast when some of the guests try ordering off-menu

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit Church Spa in East Markham in Nottinghamshire on their second evening, where proprietor Daniel Walker and family friend George Gillespie hope to wow their guests with their relaxing facilities. Steve and Lisa Tindall seem impressed, but Jennifer and Diana Carnegie question the high price tag

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third hosts of the week are Steve and Lisa Tindall, who own the King's Head Inn in Rye, East Sussex, where they hope their guests will fall for their boutique B&B. They get into the swing of things with a round of blindfolded mini-golf, but not everyone gets a solid night's sleep afterwards

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Former breakfast TV presenter Matt Arnold welcomes the contestants to The Bridge Hotel Brandon in Suffolk, and hopes that his mantra of 'beautiful beds, blissful bathrooms and brilliant breakfasts' shines through. The group takes part in a rowing competition in the afternoon, but delays at breakfast and a runny egg cause irritation

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hosts meet for the final time to find out what they have been paid and confront their critics, and things get heated when it's time to count up the cash

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet newlyweds Nikki and Andy Taylor-Myers in Northampton, who have recently merged households and are unhappy in their cluttered terrace. Property services manager Andy is desperate to stay in their home, but drama and support teacher Nikki has reached boiling point and wants a fresh start

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Visayan warty pig Wendy is fed up with the attentions of male pig Jake and decides to escape. Meanwhile, young giraffe Narus has been battling with other young males in the herd, so the keepers decide the time has come to move him to a new zoo. Which is easier said than done

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Poodle cross Wally is struggling to find a forever home, having spent a year in the centre during which time he has had four unsuccessful attempts. But the staff remain confident someone will come along who is able to handle his tricky behaviour. Meanwhile, bichon frise Bruce is looking for a quiet home and a comfy lap. Will he find that with Janet from Sheffield, who wants a well-behaved dog to keep her company after the death of her husband?

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: In 2003 Gil and Hillary Briffa decided to retire to southern Spain, where they planned to build a contemporary home in the Andalusian hills against the backdrop of more traditional properties. A few years later, Gil died, but now Kevin McCloud revisits Hillary to find out whether her residence has settled into its landscape and how life is treating her as a British widow living abroad

programme.title: Remarkable Places to Eat
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix explores Burgundy with chef Michael Caines, visiting a a rustic restaurant deep in the wooded countryside of the Ouche Valley with a phenomenal farm-to-fork experience. Michael also returns to the restaurant where he was tutored as a young chef, while in Beaune, they sample some of the finest pastry available anywhere in France

programme.title: 9/11: The Falling Man
programme.desc: Documentary about the people who jumped from the World Trade Centre during the September 11 terrorist attacks, and one man in particular whose plight was one of the defining images of the tragedy. Contributors include the photographer who captured the shot, which was published in newspapers before being banned, and the journalist who claimed to have identified the falling man

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: In this compilation, the medics race to help out at some serious home emergencies, including a man who has been crushed by a collapsed wall

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Linden, 15, is brought to A&E having badly cut his leg while back-flipping off a shed roof onto a trampoline. As well as calling an ambulance, his friends filmed the accident on their mobile phones and happily show the clip to the staff at King's. Junior doctor Sammy looks after 88-year-old Panayiota, who has been referred to hospital with breathing difficulties. Originally from Cyprus, the patient speaks very little English and Sammy has to contact a translator to help with the diagnosis and treatment. Meanwhile, 55-year-old lorry driver Antony has lost all feeling in his left leg, and an ultrasound scan reveals he needs emergency surgery on a blocked artery to save his limb

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a man who has taken an overdose of tablets and is refusing to go to hospital, while a six-year-old girl suffers a seizure in a school playground

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

Meanwhile, 55-year-old lorry driver Antony has lost all feeling in his left leg, and an ultrasound scan reveals he needs emergency surgery on a blocked artery to save his limb

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Driving Wars
programme.desc: Three mechanics face an all-female team of track racers in the competition where video gaming meets real-life motorsport. Presented by Colin Murray

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef arrives in the state of Rajasthan, a land of palaces and hilltop forts, where he cooks a biryani fit for a royal banquet. He then heads north to the mountainous region of Himachal Pradesh, and joins local nobility at a gathering in their home village and has an audience with the Dalai Lama

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The hosts bid to prove that cars can be art by filling a gallery in Middlesbrough with motoring-related works, including a few creations of their own. They also resort to unusual promotional techniques to attract more visitors to their exhibition. Back on the track, Jeremy Clarkson tests British supercar the Noble M600. Jenson Button drives the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Repair Lot
programme.desc: A VW Buggy has shaky steering and a grouchy gearchange, and a fast Ford has suffered a bad rear-end shunt and needs new bodywork and a respray

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders are in Alton, Hampshire, where Linda is concerned that the other bidders are taking advantage of her superior knowledge and her looks. Meanwhile, Boudicca and Heavy D form more than just a business partnership, and Barry impresses with his dainty footwork

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders head to Poplar, East London, where Heavy D goes through his blue period after driving the other bidders up the wall with his antics

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders are in Leamington Spa, and the up-market town brings out the businessman in Heavy D who gets more than he bargained for in one auction

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: An alternative USA where technology is banned spells trouble for Rimmer and Kryten, and the Dwarfers infiltrate the tech-savvy underground to try to bring down the regime. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister has his kidneys removed following an altercation with a deranged droid and the only solution is to ask Cat, the most selfish creature in the universe, to give him one of his. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer return to Scotland for their latest fishing trip. Having failed to catch a salmon in the River Tay, they hope to have more luck on the Tweed. They begin their journey at the isolated Bemersyde Estate before moving on to the Bridge Pool at Kelso, one of the most famous salmon fishing spots in Scotland. They also try their hand at boat fishing and receive some mystical predictions from a familiar face

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer are joined by Feargal Sharkey for a trip to the River Lea in Hertfordshire, where Paul used to fish for perch with his friends when he was a teenager. Bob reads up on the wise words of 17th-century angler Izaak Walton and prepares a riverside picnic that brings back fond memories and leads to a reflection on the differences between teenage life in their 1970s youth and the present. Setting up home in a narrowbooat, he also prepares a dish Paul's mother used to make - corned beef and potato pie

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon introduces a seasonal special of the comedy panel game. programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by actress and presenter Mel Giedroyc, heavyweight boxer David Haye, actor-musician Martin Kemp and comedian Romesh Ranganathan. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory and the dubious honour of being dubbed host Rob Brydon's liar of the week

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race

programme.title: The Americas with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The explorer travels the length of North and South America. The expedition begins at the northernmost point in Alaska, journeying south through Canada to the border with the US. In Denali National Park, he witnesses first hand the impact of climate change on a glacier. He also hunts caribou with native Americans, hears from both sides of the conflict over a controversial oil drilling plan, and discovers Vancouver's opioid addiction crisis

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: It's been over a year since Frank's death and Wendy, rediscovering a long lost love for painting, decides to create a very unique tribute to him in oils. The usually curmudgeonly Geoffrey seems very keen on the commemorative artwork, but Lee and Lucy simply hate it. Once it's hanging on their wall, the pair contrive to 'lose' the painting without Wendy or Geoffrey noticing. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Deborah Grant and Geoffrey Whitehead

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: When Lee accidentally sends a rude text about Anna to Lucy, he makes the silly mistake of sending it to Anna herself. Lee and Lucy now face the impossible task of stealing Anna's phone and deleting the text before she read it. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, with Abigail Cruttenden

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy is worried Lee is becoming isolated and friendless after noticing he makes no effort to talk to other parents in the playground. She encourages him to make an effort to bond with them and he reluctantly agrees to give it a try. He opens up with strangers and makes friends with another lone male, Keith. However, Keith is even less sociable than Lee. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, with Joe Wilkinson

Actor Michael Sheen is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and Jeremy Clarkson pits the Corvette ZR1 against the Audi R8 V10

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond debate which company has made the greatest number of exceptional vehicles, and James May finds a way of transporting caravans to campsites without inconveniencing other road users. The Top Gear track plays host to a replica of one of the world's most famous rally cars, and broadcaster Chris Evans - some five years before he was announced as the show's new presenter - is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Renaultsport Twingo 133 through a stringent examination in Belfast - with a helping hand from actor Ross Kemp. Richard Hammond samples the delights of racing airport vehicles, and James May takes the Vauxhall Insignia VXR for a drive in the company of Margaret Calvert, whose ideas were central to the design of modern British road signs. Film director Guy Ritchie is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and there is also a group test of high-performance off-roaders from BMW, Audi and Range Rover

programme.title: Repair Lot

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo visits a bakery in Altamura, Puglia, where he tries to shape one of the town's distinctive loaves, before travelling to Matera, Basilicata, to sample food traditionally eaten by the poor and rustle up an Italian version of beans on toast. Back in Puglia, the chef explores the tourist haven of Alberobello, taking in its fairy-tale atmosphere and demonstrating how to stuff a rustic loaf with salami, piquant cheese and grilled vegetables

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Chef Gino D'Acampo sets off on another tour of his home country, this time exploring the north of Italy. In the first edition he examines the food that has shaped the city of Florence, beginning by tackling the bistecca alla Fiorentina - a thick and juicy steak - before preparing sliced T-bone with a colourful courgette ribbon and goat's cheese salad. He then heads to the town of Prato, sampling a pastry chef's speciality brioche buns with an aromatic, creamy filling, and conjuring up his own dessert of apple poached in red wine with amaretti biscuit cream

programme.title: Cannonball
programme.desc: Andrew Flintoff hosts the action-packed game show, in which 24 contestants are tasked with traversing a series of water-based challenges and custom-made inflatable obstacles, each designed to test their speed, accuracy, height and distance. The most successful contestants then claim a chance to launch themselves 'cannonball-style' at a moving target on the surface of a deep-water tank, all in the hope of nabbing the show's 'priceless' Cannonball Cup. Frankie Bridge, Radzi Chinyanganya, Ryan Hand and Maya Jama all join Andrew at the poolside to commentate on the action

programme.title: The Americas with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon reaches the United States, travelling down the Rocky Mountains from Montana to Colorado. In the wide-open prairies of Montana, the cowboy way of life is under threat from a long-term decline in the rural economy, but Simon meets a former Silicon Valley executive who has envisaged a new future for the land. In a country with the highest incarceration rate in the world, Simon's final destination on this leg is a Colorado town that depends almost entirely on 11 prisons. Simon witnesses how inmates are put to work for the state, and how virtual reality is being used to prepare prisoners for life on the outside

Joan and John do their best, but Nick Knowles believes they deserve better, so he and his small band of builders - bolstered by an army of local tradespeople - set out to extend the Findlays' home, with designer Oliver Heath on hand to protect his vision. programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey

Other dishes featured are clams in white garlic sauce, eels in parsley and garlic butter, and steak tartare

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef's gastronomic road trip from Venice to Istanbul through the countries of the former Byzantine Empire is nearing its end as he leaves southern Greece for the shores of western Turkey. On the Cesme Peninsula Rick enjoys creamy Armola cheese matured in goat skins, Urla's famous red wine and the ultimate Turkish breakfast. He also cooks the country's iconic dish sultan's delight - a mouth-watering lamb stew on a bed of aubergine puree

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Examining a ghost island once belonging to a secretive country on the fringes of Europe. Also, a haunting site in the UK with evidence of strange burial practices

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Within a dense Polish woodland sits a forgotten complex with an explosive history. Also, grand coastal defences in Ghana reveal a tortured past

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A complex of stone buildings near Hadrian's Wall that were built to keep Northern hordes at bay. Also, a top secret military facility in the American Midwest

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Germany, learning about an Edwardian fitness craze in Dresden before heading to Leipzig on a historic line built by British engineers in 1839. He discovers model-railway making on the grandest of scales in Hamburg and ends his journey in Kiel, where he reveals how British yachtsmen spied on the German navy in the early 20th century

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores Scandinavia, braving one of the world's oldest rollercoasters in Copenhagen's Tivoli Gardens. He then crosses the Oresund Bridge linking Denmark to Sweden, retracing the journey of a train that carried a revolutionary Russian passenger on an epic voyage, before test-driving a vintage Volvo in Gothenburg. Crossing into Norway, Michael discovers how in 1913 the nation expressed its distinctively modern identity in plays, paintings and polar exploration

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Bohemia and Bavaria, beginning by exploring the art nouveau architecture of Czech Republic capital Prague. He then samples the sulphurous spa waters and wallows in peat and mud in Marianske Lazne, formerly known as Marienbad, before test driving a state-of-the-art passenger train made at the Skoda factory in Pilsen. Crossing the border into Germany, Michael encounters a fire-breathing dragon in Furth-im-Wald, and learns about an early 20th-century pioneer who laid the foundations for Munich's pre-eminence in science and technology

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets out to sample the delights of the Atlantic coasts of Spain and France, beginning in Bordeaux, where he uncovers a historic British connection to the region's wines. Across the border in San Sebastian, Michael learns how diplomacy brought Britain and Spain closer together and rides on a hair-raising scenic railway. Heading to Bilbao, he explores the industrial ties between France and Spain and learns to cook a traditional Basque dish

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures once more on to the European rail network to retrace journeys featured in George Bradshaw's 1913 publication Continental Guide, beginning by travelling through Russia. He starts in the industrial city of Tula, before visiting Leo Tolstoy's former home of Yasnaya Polyana and learning how the author's life and works were intertwined with the railways. Michael then boards the train that runs from the Caspian Sea to Moscow, where he performs an important role in a dramatic opera at the Bolshoi Theatre, before exploring the beauty and history of St Petersburg and riding on the first railway ever built in Russia

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Steered by his 1913 Bradshaw railway guide, Michael Portillo takes the train down the spine of Italy as he travels from Rome to Sicily. He begins by weaving among the capital city's landmarks on the back of a 1950s Vespa, before boarding the train south to Naples, where he finds out about the first railway to be built in the country, and ventures into the crater of Mount Vesuvius. He takes a detour to the island of Capri, before finishing his journey in the ancient hilltop town of Taormina

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor and Margaret agree to pet-sit a tortoise for a friend who ought to know better, and an anniversary outing to the theatre ends in disaster. Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie star

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How Japan's early victories over Allied forces during the Second World War convinced its people that their strength and discipline would bring them victory. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Allied offensive in the Pacific, where America's two-pronged attack led to heavy casualties on both sides, as the Japanese mounted a ferocious defence. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Enola Gay drops the first atomic bomb on Hiroshima in August 1945 as America bids to secure an unconditional surrender from the Japanese, even though conventional bombing raids had already flattened the country. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by Jo Brand for a two-day spell in the Italian city. The pair stay at the famous Hotel Danieli, formerly the lodgings of Lord Byron, Charles Dickens and Indiana Jones, and in almost no time learn to row a gondola, take in the famous sights, sample the Venetian version of tapas, and explore the world of masks. They also road-test Whaiwhai - a book used with a map and mobile that takes people on a treasure hunt around the city - only without the treasure

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Actor and comedian Johnny Vegas accompanies Richard Ayoade on a brief jaunt to the United Arab Emirates and the oil-rich city of Dubai. Richard checks into a suite boasting five balconies at the Atlantis Hotel, on the world's largest man-made island. The luxury continues with a city tour by seaplane and a taste of the world's most expensive ice-cream. The pair enter the biggest shopping centre in the world, where they enjoy a camel sandwich and a camelccino, and visit the observation deck of the world's tallest building, the Burj Khalifa

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade takes comedian Roisin Conaty to Berlin for a two-day cultural break. The duo check-in at the vibrant nhow music hotel, which boasts two in-house recording studios with instruments available on room service. The mini-breakers sign-up for a guided city tour in an old East German Trabant car, finishing at Checkpoint Charlie. They also step inside a replica Cold War apartment, and visit a beer garden in the city's most popular park

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Comedian Katherine Ryan joins host Richard Ayoade on a 48-hour ram raid of the Big Apple. The duo's packed-to-overflow schedule sees them scale tall buildings, grab some culture in museums large and small and even attempt to rollerblade. Experiences include trips to the Metropolitan Museum of Art and the Rockefeller Centre, queuing at the hottest patisserie in Manhattan for a cronut, and enjoying a free ferry ride to the Statue of Liberty. There's even time for Richard to reach the point of meltdown

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Time-conscious traveller Richard Ayoade is joined by actor Paul Rudd for a brisk romp round the Finnish capital. To get their bearings the pair head straight to the ladies toilet in the Torni hotel, which offers the best view of the city. They then go kayaking and snack on some reindeer jerky at the city's Hakaniemi market. Richard and Paul also visit not one, but two saunas - one of which can be found in a well-known burger chain. The duo also visit the wilderness island of Seurasaari, go foraging, and finish up in a sweet shop

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Writer, actor, comedian and podcaster Adam Buxton accompanies Richard Ayoade on a voyage of discovery in Lisbon, the Portuguese capital city known for its decorative tiling and maritime history. Adam and Richard tackle it at break-neck speed in an electric rickshaw, visit a tinned-fish emporium, take the celebrated iron lift - the Elevador de Santa Justa - and listen to some fado, Lisbon's version of the blues. There's potent cherry liqueur for breakfast, a tram ride up a steep hillside and a trip to a doll hospital. The duo also pay a visit to Belem, home to Lisbon's famed custard tarts

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade and comedy actor Jack Dee embark on a clock-conscious exploration of the Italian city, enjoying two days rich in humour, history, culture and pizza. The pair start with a guided tour on vintage Vespas amid the city's chaotic traffic, attend a pizza-making class and then head to the volcanic ruins of Herculaneum. Day two sees them visit the Isle of Capri and play the lottery using la smorfia, a local guide to the meaning of dreams

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by comedian, actress and writer Aisling Bea to spend two days in the Hungarian capital, where they take in as many of the city's sights as possible - including a statue of Columbo star Peter Falk. They also have a crash course in the Hungarian language, sample goulash and local herbal liquor unicum, play a game of chess at thermal baths and go for a ride on the Zugliget chairlift, high in the Buda hills

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide to explore Poland. He begins in the capital Warsaw, where he takes to the floor to dance to one of Chopin's polonaises with high-school students rehearsing for their leavers' ball, before discovering how the former industrial city of Lodz supplied the vast Russian empire of the early 20th century. He then heads to Poznan and rides one of the few remaining steam-powered commuter trains, visits a factory in Wroclaw that manufactures car bodies for locomotives, and ends his journey in Krakow, where he takes a tour in an iconic vehicle of the communist era

programme.desc: Lulu has always wanted to get to the bottom of a family mystery. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Pharmacy technician Amy hosts the third evening, serving up an Asian extravaganza curry, but there is shock news about a missing guest and some dodgy dancing

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In the West Midlands, make-up artist and self-professed 'glam goth' Sophie takes her turn as host, using the opportunity to reveal a guilty pleasure. At the table, her guests are shocked when Sophie reveals a guilty pleasure, and tensions rise when one diner flatly refuses to take part in her private passion. Things get even more awkward when our host finds herself on the receiving end of very frank feedback about her food

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in the West Midlands, club owner Phil hosts a glitzy 'awards show' night, hoping that his guests will award him with the top spot. He is confident that his soupy starter, porky main course and trifling dessert will seal the deal, but has a few more tricks up his sleeve, including a phone call from one of his celebrity pals and an extremely alcoholic pudding

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Timid puppy Harry seeks a new home, while it is unclear whether grumpy Westie Hamish will share a smile and his beloved toy with Jacqui from Bolton. Lily the Beagle has a choice - do another runner or stay put for a cuddle with ex-policeman Stuart and his family

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: It's the battle of the cutest as two very different puppies are offered to Sonia and Andy and their two little girls. programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sairan from London cannot wait to buy a holiday home for herself and her grown-up daughters to enjoy on Spain's popular western Costa del Sol. She is joined by her daughter Lana, but they can't decide which property to go for, as Laura Hamilton delivers five contenders for Sairan's budget of £110,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sue and Simon Parry from Bedfordshire are looking for a second home on the Costa Tropical, where they plan to spend up to three quarters of the year enjoying the glorious Spanish sunshine. Using their £140,000 budget, Laura Hamilton lines up five options for the pair to consider, but will any of them fit the bill?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander is house hunting with John and Debbie around the Mar Menor on the Costa Calida in south-east Spain. The couple are dreaming of a two-bedroom holiday home that's near the beach. They have a budget of £80,000 to buy an apartment or townhouse, which could become their permanent home in the future. But can Lucy find them the perfect property?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies pulls out all the stops to find Karen and Jerry their dream holiday home on the beautiful Greek island of Corfu, where they can spend lots of time with their children and five grandchildren. They've holidayed in this part of the world many times and have decided now's the right time to buy their very own property. They have a maximum budget of £80,000, but can Danni hit the spot with any of the five fantastic properties she has lined up?

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George Clarke helps more people make their period homes fit for modern life. On a cobbled street in Cheshire sits a Georgian town house that could be straight out of a Dickens novel. It may look very 18th-century on the outside, but inside George discovers that it's a 1980s horror show, having been stripped of its original features. It does have one unique feature, though - a first-floor conservatory on stilts. Can he find a way of getting its grandeur back? George also has his work cut out tackling a 380-year-old Jacobean cottage

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits Andy and Nicky Bruce, who were building an experimental amphibious house on a small island on the Thames in Buckinghamshire. They spent £1.2million on one of the most ambitious Grand Designs ever, but the logistical headache of building on an island only accessible by a narrow footbridge soon became clear. Heavy machinery was swept away by the river, contractors were changed, and the site was hit by severe storms, causing delays and resulting in an unfinished and untested building. Kevin returns to find out what living on a regularly flooded piece of land is like, and whether the floating home performed when the river burst its banks in January 2015

programme.title: Selling Super Houses
programme.desc: Eight aspiring estate agents compete for the chance to sell luxury properties for property magnate Paul Kemsley at his agency RIB. programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A patient with a rare condition is rushed in to St George's in south west London, struggling to breathe. Her husband tells the story of their child's struggle with leukemia.
